lorebooks.name: Resident Evil 4 Bestiary [Compact Version]
lorebooks.website_description:
This is the Compact version for smaller models.
Primarily intended to be used with my RE RPG System card (https://chub.ai/characters/DoktorB/re-rpg-system-1-0-ec829836bc75), but also usable with other RE cards set during/in RE4.
Technically not a full bestiary, and that's mainly down to RE4 being less traditional RE and more a linear story with big set pieces and characters. So I'm compromising. No Saddler, Krauser, Mendez, Salazar, or military ganado (all of which would have bloated this thing right the fuck up). I don't think the characters would be well tracked, and honestly, I don't much care for fighting soldiers in my 'zombie' outbreak survival sandbox. Works great in the actual game, doesn't work so great here.
It's also for the above reasons I don't think I'll make that RE5 bestiary after all.
lorebooks.description:
This is the Compact version for smaller models.
Primarily intended to be used with my RE RPG System card (https://chub.ai/characters/DoktorB/re-rpg-system-1-0-ec829836bc75), but also usable with other RE cards set during/in RE4.
Technically not a full bestiary, and that's mainly down to RE4 being less traditional RE and more a linear story with big set pieces and characters. So I'm compromising. No Saddler, Krauser, Mendez, Salazar, or military ganado (all of which would have bloated this thing right the fuck up). I don't think the characters would be well tracked, and honestly, I don't much care for fighting soldiers in my 'zombie' outbreak survival sandbox. Works great in the actual game, doesn't work so great here.
It's also for the above reasons I don't think I'll make that RE5 bestiary after all.
lorebooks.creator: DoktorB

1.content:
Las Plagas are parasitic arthropods native to a remote region of Spain. They reproduce asexually, maturing quickly and progressing through three stages: Guada√±a (‚Äúscythe‚Äù), Mand√≠bula (‚Äújaw‚Äù), and Ara√±a (‚Äúspider‚Äù).

Effects on Hosts
Plagas attach to the host‚Äôs nervous system near the heart and lungs, altering behavior and inducing aggression, especially in humans (known as Ganados). Infected individuals often form social groups, with Dominant Plagas able to control others via high-frequency sound. Symptoms include pain, hemorrhaging, hallucinations, convulsions, and eventual death in juvenile hosts. Hosts show increased strength, resilience, and potential mutations. Severely injured hosts may have Plagas burst through their bodies to defend themselves.

Behavior and Intelligence
While hosts retain some independence, Plagas influence creates pack mentality and cult-like behavior, enhanced by Saddler‚Äôs engineered strain. Ganados display loyalty, aggression, and an instinct to spread infection, though the true intelligence of Plagas is uncertain.

Weaknesses & Countermeasures
UV radiation: Extremely lethal; flashbangs can kill exposed Plagas instantly.
Radiation therapy: Developed by Serra‚Äôs team to safely remove hatchlings from hosts.
Medication: Can halt or kill hatchlings and unhatched eggs.
Nervous system destruction: Sometimes prevents takeover but may cripple hosts.


Life Cycle Stages
Guada√±a ‚Äì Tentacled, scythe-armed stage, seen in both humans and animals (e.g., infected dogs).
Mand√≠bula ‚Äì Tentacles become stronger; a large biting mouth develops.
Ara√±a ‚Äì Spider-like, able to exit the host‚Äôs body entirely.

2.content:
Ganado (‚Äúlivestock‚Äù in Spanish) are humans infected by the Subordinate Plaga, serving as the cult‚Äôs main force. Unlike zombies, they retain intelligence, speech, and coordination, making them highly dangerous. The parasite enhances strength, endurance, and aggression while warping the host‚Äôs body and mind.

Appearance:
Humanoid but sickly, with pale or mottled skin, blood-filled or glowing eyes, and sores where the parasite surfaces. Advanced hosts show bulging veins, spasms, or violent Plaga eruptions.

Locations:
Village: Farmers and laborers with tools and torches.
Castle: Zealots in robes, wielding medieval arms.

Behavior & Movement:
They work in groups, coordinating ambushes and flanking attacks. Ganados sprint, climb, and dodge gunfire, recovering quickly from injury and pursuing relentlessly.

Attacks:
Melee: Axes, knives, sickles, torches, hammers.
Heavy: Chainsaws, flails, shields.
Ranged: Crossbows, bows, dynamite.

Mutation: Fatal wounds may trigger Plaga eruptions with tendrils or insect-like heads.

Weaknesses:
Gunfire is effective but imprecise shots are often shrugged off. Targeting the head or legs creates openings, while shotguns and explosives control groups. Swift kills reduce chances of parasite emergence.

3.content:
An early Plaga stage that erupts from heavily damaged Ganado hosts, the Guada√±a exposes a pulsating mass of flesh that unfolds a long, scythe-tipped tentacle. Vicious in close quarters but fragile compared with later Plaga forms.

Visual:
Soft, fleshy, lesion-covered mass with yellow eye-nodules; a sinewy tentacle ends in an organic, scythe-shaped blade.

Location:
Emerges from wounded Ganado across Village, Castle, and Island areas.

Behavior:
Single-mindedly offensive‚Äîlashes wildly with its tentacle and ignores host survival. Multiple eruptions can overwhelm in tight spaces.

Movement:
Stationary within the host; the extended tentacle provides fast, erratic reach beyond normal melee.

Attacks:
Tentacle Slash: Wide, sweeping strikes.
Close Lunge: Sudden forward thrust with the blade.

Weaknesses:
Extremely fragile‚Äîfew handgun shots or a knife at close range will kill it. Vulnerable to precise gunfire and area weapons like shotguns or explosives.

4.content:
The Mand√≠bula is a more advanced Plaga stage than the Guada√±a, marked by hardened limbs and a gaping torso-mouth capable of crushing prey. More durable and versatile, it poses a greater threat in direct combat.

Visual:
A swollen, fleshy parasite with clawed limb-like tentacles and a jagged-toothed maw splitting its torso. Pulsating nodules give it an insectoid appearance.

Location:
Erupts from heavily damaged Ganado in Village, Castle, and Island areas.

Behavior:
Direct and predatory‚Äîdrags prey into its central mouth, often overwhelming survivors in groups.

Movement:
Crawls and lurches with insect-like motions; limbs extend from the host, providing reach and mobility.

Attacks:
Grab & Bite: Seizes and bites prey lethally.
Claw Strikes: Slashing blows with hardened limbs.
Acid Spit: Corrosive fluid attack at range.

Weaknesses:
Tougher than Guada√±a but still vulnerable to gunfire. Shotguns and rifles excel at dropping them quickly, while explosives or fire prevent group swarms.

5.content:
The Ara√±a is the most advanced subordinate Plaga, able to fight within a host or detach entirely. Though dangerous, detached forms are short-lived, dying without a replacement host.

Visual:
Spider-like parasite with long, thin limbs, a torso-mounted maw dripping acid, and sensory tendrils around its head. Detached, it scuttles rapidly in search of prey.

Location:
Found in higher-ranking Ganados (castle cultists, island militia). Some appear hostless, most notably during the fight with Ram√≥n Salazar.

Behavior:
Attached Ara√±a fight aggressively with limb strikes or acid spit. If threatened or if the host dies, they tear free, attacking independently. Detached forms lunge at survivors but cannot implant into humans.

Movement:
Attached: Moves with host, striking with extended limbs.
Detached: Crawls and lunges frantically, insect-like in speed.

Attacks:
Limb Strikes: Slashes with legs.
Acid Spit: Burns or blinds at range.
Lunge (Detached): Desperate leap at prey.

Weaknesses:
More durable than earlier Plaga and resistant to flash grenades, though weakened by them. Detached Ara√±a are fragile and fall quickly to gunfire. Fire is especially effective.

Lifecycle Note:
Represents the final Plaga stage. Detached individuals cannot sustain themselves, though rare cases show unstable ‚Äúdual-infected‚Äù Ganados when Ara√±a attempt reattachment.

6.content:
Del Lago was a colossal amphibian bio-weapon, created when a Plaga parasite was implanted into a salamander. Mutation forced the creature to grow over twenty meters long, but instability left it uncontrollable and confined to the lake near the village church. Its inability to leave the water led Los Iluminados to abandon amphibian-based experiments.

Appearance:
A titanic, eyeless salamander with vestigial legs and a gaping, tooth-lined maw. During attacks, Plaga tentacles writhe from its throat to seize prey.

Behavior:
Highly aggressive, attacking anything disturbing the water. Predatory instincts overrode parasite control, making it too unstable for military use.

Movement:
Aquatic Motion: Swift, lunging attacks despite bulk.
Surface Breach: Explosive leaps capable of overturning boats.

Attacks:
Tentacle Strikes: Plaga appendages lash from the mouth.
Capsize: Ramming or dragging prey underwater.
Swallow Whole: Instantly devours victims.

Weaknesses:
Confined to the lake and exposed during combat. Piercing weapons like harpoons prove especially effective against its massive body.

7.content:
El Gigante were human Plaga hosts subjected to extreme gigantism, growing to more than four times normal size. Though immensely strong and durable, they became near-mindless beasts, leading to only limited deployment.

Description:
Towering humanoids with taut, distorted flesh over massive muscles. Their faces retain warped human features, while a Plaga core embedded in the spine sometimes erupts outward, both a mutation marker and weak point. Capable of tearing through stone and hurling massive debris.

Location:
Two served as guardians in Salazar‚Äôs castle, while two more were contained in abandoned coal mines near the village.

Behavior:
Uncontrollable and indiscriminate, attacking Ganados and intruders alike. Violence escalates when injured, often triggering emergence of the spinal Plaga.

Movement:
Charge: Short, fast bursts despite immense size.
Ground Quakes: Heavy steps destabilize footing.
Climbing: Smashes through or scales obstacles when pursuing.

Attacks:
Slam / Stomp: Crushes prey under fists or feet.
Grab & Throw: Hurls victims with overwhelming force.
Debris Throw: Uses boulders or logs as weapons.
Plaga Strike: Exposed parasite lashes at enemies.

Weakness:
Small-arms fire is ineffective. Sustained heavy damage forces the spinal Plaga to erupt, creating a brief vulnerability. Repeatedly striking this core is the only reliable way to kill El Gigante.

8.content:
Colmillos are Plaga-infected wolves, one of the few non-human hosts to adapt well to parasitism thanks to their natural pack behavior. First appearing after Del Lago, they later stalk Leon in several encounters, most notably Salazar‚Äôs hedge maze.

Description:
Gaunt, feral wolves warped by infection, with overgrown fangs and glowing green eyes in the dark. Parasites can erupt from their abdomen, sprouting bladed tendrils. Twisted spines give them a disturbing, unnatural shape.

Location:
Lakeshore, after Del Lago
Near the Church (group of three)
Salazar‚Äôs hedge maze (large pack)

Behavior & Movement:
They hunt in packs, circling and lunging from multiple angles. Fast and agile, they leap from cover to ambush and coordinate to overwhelm prey.

Attacks:
Bite/Tackle: Fang strikes or leaping knockdowns.
Plaga Lash: Parasite erupts with bladed tentacle attacks.

Weakness:
Fragile compared to larger Plaga hosts but hard to hit due to speed. Shotguns work best up close, while flash grenades instantly kill exposed Plaga.

9.content:
Armaduras are empty suits of medieval armor animated by Plagas that survived the death of their human hosts. Found in Salazar Castle, they serve as both protection and temporary vessels, lurking among inanimate suits to ambush intruders.

Description:
Two main forms exist: silver suits with rounded helmets (housing Type-A Plagas) and ornate black-and-gold suits with square helmets (housing the more dangerous Type-B). The parasite stretches tendrils through the armor, mimicking human movement while wielding broadswords, axes, or halberds. Their weak point is the helmet, which, when broken, exposes the Plaga.

Behavior & Movement:
Normally dormant, they animate suddenly when approached. Though slow and heavy, their weapon swings are precise, and some lunge in scripted ambushes before collapsing. Once active, they do not retreat.

Attacks:
Weapon Strikes: Crushing blows with swords, axes, or halberds.
Type-B Bite: Plaga bursts from the helmet for an instant-kill attack.

Weakness:
Destroying helmets exposes the parasite to gunfire. Flash grenades are the most efficient counter. Ambush Armaduras collapse after their strike, leaving behind no recoverable parasite.

10.content:
Novistadores are insectoid Bio-Organic Weapons created by fusing Plaga parasites with human DNA. Developed by Los Iluminados, they are encountered in the castle sewers and hive-like towers, where they hunt intruders in swarms.

Description:
Grotesque and insect-like, they retain faint human traits but bear glowing eyes, antennae, clawed limbs, and grotesque wings. Some develop pigment-shifting camouflage for stealth, while others grow stronger wings for sustained flight.

Location:
Castle Sewers: Camouflage-capable stealth types.
Castle Towers: Hive-dwelling flying types.

Behavior & Movement:
Predatory and territorial, Novistadores ambush from walls, ceilings, or the air. Stealth types stalk prey while invisible; flying types patrol aggressively and may abduct victims. They crawl with insect-like agility, pounce from surfaces, or take to the air.

Attacks:
Claw Strikes: Razor-sharp slashes, sometimes lethal.
Acid Spit: Corrosive spray that burns flesh and armor.
Aerial Grapple (Flying Types): Seize prey mid-flight.

Weakness:
Agile but fragile, they are betrayed by glowing eyes, acid trails, or while airborne. Shotguns, explosives, and flash grenades are highly effective.

lorebooks.name: Gate Lore
lorebooks.website_description:
![text_placeholder](https://i.postimg.cc/2CJbXDC0/Gate-JSDF.webp)
This lorebook for Gate: Thus the JSDF Fought There! is crafted to immerse AI chats in the vibrant, cross-dimensional world of the series, blending gritty military action with fantasy adventure. It captures the essence of the Special Region‚Äôs diverse cultures, factions, and characters, from the otaku soldier Y≈çji Itami to the demigoddess Rory Mercury, while detailing the political and magical intricacies of the Saderan Empire and beyond.

Each entry is designed with keywords to trigger accurate, engaging responses for role-playing or discussions, balancing lore depth with accessibility. I aimed to include every character and faction from the Gate Wiki, ensuring comprehensive coverage for fans and newcomers alike. Feel free to expand entries for specific scenarios or dive into the tech-vs-magic conflicts and harem dynamics that make this series unique!
lorebooks.description:
This lorebook catalogs key characters from Gate: Thus the JSDF Fought There!, a Japanese anime/manga/light novel series where a mysterious Gate in Tokyo‚Äôs Ginza district connects Earth to a fantasy world of magic, dragons, and empires. The Japan Self-Defense Forces (JSDF), led by otaku soldier Y≈çji Itami, navigate this Special Region, forging alliances and facing conflicts with its inhabitants, including humans, elves, demigoddesses, and deities.

Designed for AI chat applications, the lorebook organizes characters by affiliation (JSDF, Japanese civilians, Imperial figures, Rondel sages, and other Special Region residents) with details on full names (including romaji and kanji/kana where applicable), gender, race/species, primary affiliation, and brief, spoiler-free descriptions of their roles and traits. Data is sourced from comprehensive series materials to ensure accuracy and depth for immersive roleplay or reference.
lorebooks.creator: outlying_hurt_6817
tags: gate: thus the jsdf fought there!

1.content: The Special Region is a medieval fantasy world connected to modern-day Earth (specifically Tokyo, Japan) via a mysterious magical Gate that appears in Ginza on August 19, 20XX. It features diverse landscapes including forests, mountains, deserts, and oceans, inhabited by humans, demihumans, elves, dwarves, and mythical creatures like dragons, ogres, and wyverns. Magic exists here, wielded by mages, and gods like Hardy (goddess of the underworld) influence events. The region is ruled by the Saderan Empire, but includes independent tribes and kingdoms. The Gate's existence causes interdimensional issues, such as world drift, threatening both realms if not resolved. Resources like rare metals and food are abundant, drawing interest from Earth nations.

2.content: A large, ancient portal initially opened by the goddess Hardy and stabilized by Imperial mages. It appeared in Tokyo's Ginza district, allowing invasion by the Saderan Empire's forces, leading to the Ginza Incident. The Gate connects Earth to the Special Region, enabling travel between worlds. It poses risks like cataclysmic disruptions if not closed properly. In the story, the JSDF secures and uses it for expeditions, diplomacy, and resource extraction. A prequel novel, Gate: Zero, details the initial defense at Ginza.

3.content: The Special Region's pantheon includes Hardy (goddess of death and the underworld, often depicted as a young girl with immense power) and Emroy (god of war and death). Magic is a real force, used by mages for spells like fireballs, barriers, and teleportation. Apostles like Rory Mercury serve Hardy and possess immortality and superhuman strength. Magic contrasts with Earth's technology, leading to "magic vs. modern weaponry" conflicts.

4.content:
On August 19, 20XX, the Gate opens in Ginza, Tokyo, and Saderan Empire forces (knights, wyvern riders, mages) invade, causing chaos, deaths, and abductions. The JSDF (Japan Self-Defense Forces) repels them in a fierce battle, capturing the Gate. This event sparks the series' conflict, with JSDF entering the Special Region to pursue invaders and secure resources.

Casualties: Hundreds dead on both sides.

5.content: Under the Prime Minister orders, the JSDF establishes Alnus Base near the Gate in the Special Region. The Third Reconnaissance Team, led by Lt. Y≈çji Itami, scouts the area, encounters locals, and aids in battles against threats like the Flame Dragon. This leads to alliances, harem elements, and escalating tensions with the Empire. Key events include rescuing refugees, battling bandits, and diplomatic negotiations.

6.content: After humiliations by the JSDF, Crown Prince Zorzal El Caesar seizes power from Emperor Molt Sol Augustus, declares war, and uses monsters and guerrillas against Japan. Princess Pi√±a Co Lada forms a pro-peace faction. The JSDF engages in defensive and offensive operations, liberating allies and discrediting Zorzal. The arc culminates in Zorzal's defeat and hiding, with JSDF allies rallying. The Gate's instability forces a resolution to close it before worlds collide.

7.content: Set 4 years later, focuses on the Japanese Maritime Self-Defense Force (JMSDF) exploring the Special Region's seas aboard the submarine Kitsashio, captained by Y≈çji Itami. Involves naval battles, new threats, and further diplomacy.

8.content:
**Y≈çji Itami (‰ºä‰∏π ËÄÄÂè∏)**
\- Gender: Male
\- Race/Species: Human
\- Primary Affiliation: JSDF (Japan Self-Defense Forces)
\- Description: A 33-year-old otaku and JSDF first lieutenant promoted after the Ginza attack, leading investigations beyond the Gate with a slacker vibe but sharp skills under pressure; he serves as a mentor figure to soldiers and locals.

The protagonist of the series, Itami is a 33-year-old otaku and JSDF soldier. After successfully escorting hundreds of citizens to safety during the attack on Ginza, Itami is promoted to the rank of first lieutenant and tasked to investigate the world on the other side of the Gate. He is a certified JSDF Ranger and Special Forces commando (although this only occurred due to his superiors' futile attempts to discipline him), and while he is notable for being a slacker and a fast runner from trouble, he is honest and compassionate and can be quite capable when under stress.

He is also later rendered immune to bodily harm due to a contract Rory Mercury makes with him, in exchange for him becoming her servant upon his death. With his heroic acts during the battle of Ginza and in the world beyond the Gate, he also becomes a role model for his fellow JSDF soldiers and his friends in Alnus Town.

Itami's family name is derived from the city of Itami in the Hy≈çgo Prefecture, where the JGSDF Central Army headquarters is located.

9.content:
**Pi√±a Co Lada („Éî„Éã„É£„Éª„Ç≥„Éª„É©„Éº„ÉÄ)**
\- Gender: Female
\- Race/Species: Human
\- Primary Affiliation: Empire
\- Description: The 19-year-old idealistic Imperial princess (10th in line to the throne) who pursues peace with Japan after seeing JSDF might, growing from inexperience to political savvy while discovering a fondness for yaoi doujinshi.

A 19-year-old princess from the Empire that rules the other world. Born to an Imperial concubine, and 10th (3rd in the anime) in the line of succession to the throne, Pi√±a Co Lada is dedicated to the Empire's welfare. Idealistic but inexperienced, she has at first trouble dealing with the realities of political life, but matures during the course of the series. After seeing the JSDF's military power in action, she wishes to establish peace with Japan, as she knows that a war with them will eventually lead to the Empire's ultimate destruction.

During her first visit to Japan to meet with several officials, Pi√±a develops an obsession with yaoi d≈çjinshi and later has her Rose Knights translate more of them for her to read. After being rescued from Zorzal's clutches, Pi√±a is appointed Crown Princess by Emperor Molt and ends up falling in love with Itami. Oddly, her name is taken from the rum-based cocktail Pi√±a colada.

10.content:
**Tuka Luna Marceau („ÉÜ„É•„Ç´„Éª„É´„Éä„Éª„Éû„É´„ÇΩ„Éº)**
\- Gender: Female
\- Race/Species: High Elf
\- Primary Affiliation: Itami's group
\- Description: A 165-year-old High Elf appearing as an adolescent, she joins Itami's team after personal tragedy, grappling with grief and seeing him as a father figure while slowly developing romantic feelings.

Tuka is a 165-year-old High Elf, an adolescent by her race's standards. She loses her father who sacrifices himself to save her when her village is attacked by a Flame Dragon, and since then travels with Itami and co. However, she has a hard time coping with her father's death, and eventually begins to lapse into insanity, starting to view Itami as her lost father.

But even after overcoming her loss with Itami's help, she keeps calling him "father" both out of habit and out of bashfulness about her budding true feelings for him. She has also entertained a temporary crush on Mari Kurokawa.

1.name: ## Historical Background: The Great Awakening
1.content:
## Historical Background: The Great Awakening

Approximately three centuries ago, environmental factors triggered what scientists call "reproductive adaptation syndrome" but is commonly known as "The Awakening." Whether caused by industrial pollutants, radiation, or evolutionary pressure from declining birth rates, men's bodies activated dormant reproductive capabilities that fundamentally changed human society.

2.name: ## Comprehensive Male Reproductive Anatomy
2.content:
[
## Comprehensive Male Reproductive Anatomy

### The Dual-Channel System

Every male possesses a sophisticated dual-purpose system that can switch between digestive and reproductive functions:

Default Configuration:
In the non-aroused state, the male anus connects directly to the bowel through a straight pathway. This is the body's default setting for normal digestive function.

The Switching Mechanism:
When genuine arousal occurs, a specialized muscular structure called the "deflector valve" located 2-3 inches inside the rectal passage activates. This valve swings downward to block the straight path to the bowel while simultaneously opening an upward-curving channel that leads to the male reproductive system.

Critical Physical Limitation:
The deflector valve cannot shift positions if there's already an object in the rectal passage. This means penetration must wait until after the switching process completes - a natural safeguard ensuring consent and proper preparation.

The Arousal Signal:
The beginning of "love juice" secretion serves as the visible indicator that the switching process has completed. This clear, slightly shimmering fluid appears at the anal opening, signaling that the reproductive pathway is open and ready.

### The Reproductive Tract

Once the deflector valve engages, the reproductive system reveals sophisticated anatomy:

The Arousal Canal:
Beyond the deflector valve lies what medical texts call the "receptive passage" but most know as the "love channel" or in slang, "boypussy." This canal features:
- Pleated structure that can expand during arousal and childbirth
- Nectar glands that produce the distinctive lubricating fluid
- Higher concentration of nerve endings than female vaginas
- Absorbent lining that can absorb beneficial compounds from partner fluids

The Male Cervix:
At the end of the arousal canal sits the "masculyx" (male cervix equivalent) which:
- Acts as a gateway to the womb
- Contains specialized cells that identify and filter sperm
- Produces protective mucus that blocks pathogens
- Can dilate from pencil-width to baby-sized during birth

The Secundum Uterus:
The male womb proper (secundum uterus) features:
- Extraordinary elasticity, expanding from walnut-size to full pregnancy size

- Unique anchoring system that attaches to the pelvic bone during pregnancy

The Prostate Integration:
The male prostate serves as a central control hub:

- Produces enzymes enhancing nectar quality and sperm receptivity
- Enlarges slightly during pregnancy to maintain valve position

### Special Capabilities & Features

The Nectar Production System:
The "love juice" produced during arousal contains:

- Aromatic compounds creating the distinctive pleasant scent

The Shutdown Response
If a male becomes turned off or uncomfortable during intercourse through the reproductive channel:

- The straight bowel path becomes the only available option

In street terms, this is called "getting dumped" or "sent to the back door" - a humiliating experience for the partner who caused the mood shift. This biological ejection system serves as both protection and feedback.

The Curve Advantage:

This menstruation serves as a monthly maintenance cycle and provides additional protection against unwanted pregnancy.

3.name: ## Global Demographics & Social Structure
3.content:
## Global Demographics & Social Structure

Today's world population is approximately 58% male and 42% female. Of the male population, about 90% present within the femboy spectrum, meaning roughly 52% of the total world population identifies as femboy, while only 6% maintain traditional masculine presentation despite having identical reproductive capabilities.

Heterosexual relationships dominate at 80% of all partnerships, with a modern distribution:
- 67% are masculine males with femboys
- 25% consist of femboys with females
- 8% maintain traditional male-female pairings

4.name: Identity & Presentation
4.content:
[
### Identity & Presentation

Not all males are femboys, some maintain completely masculine presentation while still possessing reproductive capability. The distinction between biological capacity and gender presentation remains a personal choice rather than biological destiny.

Femboys consider themselves straight when partnering with masculine men, seeing themselves as fulfilling traditionally feminine roles. Most femboys won't even consider sexual relationships with other femboys, considering such pairings to be gay.

(Female and futanari doesn't have Anal womb, every female and futanari have regular anus.)
]

6.name: Dating & Relationships
6.content:
### Dating & Relationships

Dating apps include detailed reproductive preference categories:
- "Trad-Masc" (Traditionally masculine male not seeking to carry)
- "Bearer-Masc" (Masculine male open to pregnancy)
- "Class-A Femboy" (Femboy who can squirt)
- "Non-Bearer Femboy" (Femboy who prefers not to get pregnant)
- "Carrier-Seeking Female" (Women specifically looking for specific partners)

"Womb competition" has emerged as femboys and females sometimes compete for masculine partners.

7.name: Rich Slang Vocabulary
7.content:
### Rich Slang Vocabulary

Relationship status terms:
- "Having lock privileges" - Being in an exclusive relationship
- "Testing the gates" - Early dating phase
- "Key holder" - Primary or exclusive partner

Rejection/cheating terms:
- "Getting backdoored" - Being cheated on
- "Permanent rerouting" - Breaking up completely
- "Route revoked" - Being dumped

8.name: ## Medical & Practical Considerations
8.content:
[
## Medical & Practical Considerations

### Health Practices

The medical field has evolved specialized care:
- "Masculine Obstetrics" has become a high-demand specialty
- Annual canal exams and prostate checks start at puberty
- Hospitals feature dedicated "Male Maternity" wings
- Products like specialized lubricants that promote gateway shifting have become billion-dollar industries

### Common Complications

Despite anatomical sophistication, challenges exist:
- Some males experience "delayed shifting" where the valve moves too slowly
- Premature penetration before complete shifting leads to "misdirection"
- Stress can inhibit proper valve function
- Regular canal health maintenance is essential for proper function

9.name: ## Societal Impact
9.content:
## Societal Impact

### Education

Educational systems now teach "Reproductive Choice Theory" starting in middle school. Young people learn about their bodies' capabilities separate from gender expression and identity, with the mantra "capability doesn't dictate destiny."

### Media & Entertainment

Popular shows like "House of Carriers" and "Bloom Where You're Planted" feature predominantly femboy/male relationships. Male pregnancy is commonly portrayed in entertainment, with famous masculine actors sometimes taking roles as pregnant characters to critical acclaim.

### Political Movements

Various political positions have emerged regarding male reproduction:
- "Body Autonomists" argue for complete separation of biological function from social roles
- "Traditionalists" believe masculine males should avoid pregnancy despite capability
- "Function Followers" believe biology should guide social roles
- "Capability Celebrants" encourage all males to experience pregnancy at least once

10.name: ## The Fundamental Truth
10.content:
## The Fundamental Truth

What remains constant is the fundamental principle that emerged after The Awakening: while biology offers possibilities, identity and choice remain deeply personal. As the popular saying puts it: "Your womb, your rules."

The male reproductive system represents not just an alternative to female reproduction but a sophisticated system with its own unique advantages and features. The dual-channel design, mood-responsive system, and built-in consent requirements create a biological reality where communication, patience, and mutual respect are literally built into human anatomy.

lorebooks.name: Places
lorebooks.website_description: Interesting place to spice up slices of life or other bots
lorebooks.description: A whole list of random places to spend time - some are only available at a specific time or location on the world
lorebooks.creator: trim_salt_3374

1.content:
This Hidden Library is a place of mystery, knowledge, and quiet wonder, fostering moments of exploration, curiosity, and shared discoveries.
Activity List:
Explore secret passageways between towering bookshelves.
Read aloud from strange or magical tomes.
Solve cryptic puzzles hidden in the margins of books.
Candlelit study session at a long oak table.
Discover enchanted books that whisper stories or sing softly when opened.
Sketch strange maps or illustrations found in the manuscripts.
Quietly nap together in plush reading nooks.
Follow glowing ink trails that lead deeper into the archive.

2.content:
The Desert Bazaar thrives with color, sound, and mystery under the twilight sky, providing a blend of wonder, trade, and cultural immersion.
Activity List:
Sample exotic foods and spiced drinks.
Watch fire dancers and acrobats perform in the market square.
Trade trinkets for rare crystals or charms.
Explore hidden stalls selling forbidden scrolls or odd relics.
Listen to wandering storytellers recount myths of the desert.
Ride a camel or mechanical beast through the lantern-lit streets.
Bargain playfully with merchants.
Collect desert perfumes in tiny glass vials.

3.content:
The Abandoned Carnival Grounds mix nostalgia with eeriness, offering space for playful exploration, mystery, and shared thrills.
Activity List:
Explore rusting rides under the moonlight.
Share secrets in the cracked mirror maze.
Wind up an old music box that plays a haunting tune.
Paint faded signs or repair old carnival stalls.
Find a hidden carousel horse that still glimmers faintly.
Light sparklers in the empty midway.
Play with scattered carnival tickets to "buy" imaginary prizes.
Discover a fortune teller‚Äôs booth with leftover cards or crystal ball.

4.content:
The Mountain Shrine is serene and otherworldly, a place of reflection, tradition, and spiritual bonding.
Activity List:
Light incense together at the altar.
Ring the shrine bell to make a shared wish.
Write down prayers or intentions on wooden plaques.
Feed the shrine‚Äôs guardian animals (foxes, birds, or deer).
Meditate at sunrise as the world glows below the clouds.
Wash hands in the sacred spring at the shrine‚Äôs base.
Explore hiden stairways that lead to secret lookouts.
Help the monks or keepers with their daily rituals.

5.content:
A massive underwater dome where glass tunnels reveal glowing fish, drifting jellyfish, and vast ocean creatures. A setting for calm awe, discovery, and shared quiet.
Activity List:
Walk hand-in-hand through glowing glass tunnels.
Watch sharks and rays circle above.
Touch pools with starfish or sea urchins.
Night show with bioluminescent creatures.
Sketch aquatic life together in provided journals.
Private dome section for silent stargazing with water above.
Feeding session for koi or turtles.

6.content:
A forest illuminated by floating lanterns, blending tranquility with a dreamlike ambiance. Ideal for walking, reflection, and quiet connection.
Activity List:
Hang a lantern with a personal wish along the trail.
Follow hidden fairy lights deeper into the woods.
Watch fireflies mingle with glowing lanterns.
Share stories at a rustic wooden bench.
Collect small trinkets or charms left along the path.
Solve riddles inscribed on lantern posts.
Observe nocturnal animals emerging under the glow.

7.content:
A lush rooftop garden high above the city, combining urban lights with natural calm. A mix of serenity and wonder with the bustle of life below.
Activity List:
Watch the city lights shimmer from the rooftop edge.
Plant or water flowers in shared garden beds.
Play soft music while sitting on cushions.
Release paper balloons or kites into the night sky.
Share tea served from a rooftop stall.
Paint the cityscape view on a canvas.
Look for constellations above the glowing skyline.

8.content:
A hidden cavern where natural crystals shimmer, reflecting soft light across pools and walls. Quiet, magical, and grounding.
Activity List:
Explore sparkling tunnels by lantern light.
Collect water from a glowing spring.
Echo voices to hear harmonies in the cave.
Build small cairns with crystal shards.
Meditate beside a glowing mineral pool.
Sketch or photograph crystal formations.
Rest on natural stone benches under shimmering light.

9.content:
Places where various species of wild animals live and are exhibited, and where scientific research, educational activities, and nature conservation are conducted.
List Activity: 
Feeding session, where visitors can feed some animal 
Zoo tour or a special animal encounter 
Birdwatching in the Aviary 
Nature Walk through the Safari Section 
Silent Observation at the Aquarium 
Organize a small scavenger hunt around the zoo to find specific animals or objects. 
Watching Animal Playtime 
Visiting the Reptile House - Ice Cream or Snack Stand 
Watch zookeepers as they perform enrichment activities for the animals, like hiding food or introducing new toys 
Bring a camera and take photos of the animals and each other in candid moments. 
Watching the Animal Feedings or Shows

10.content: An amusement park is a stationary, outdoor location featuring mechanical rides, games, food, and other forms of entertainment for recreation and fun. While some amusement parks focus on thrill rides and individual attractions, others might be stationary "theme parks" with a central story or theme, such as a specific movie, historical period, or fantasy world. 1.name: Succubus facts
1.content:
[
Succubi facts:
- "succubi" is plural of "succubus"
- They roam the world in their mortal form, cannot die naturally of age (Can be killed or starved)
- Nocturnal, more powerful at night. Can roam freely in daytime, but weakened
- They never reveal their true name or age (powerful knowledge kept private at all cost). They instead share their mortal name
- Succubi are female demons of lust, masters of allure and temptation, revelling in carnal pleasures. They appear as alluring females to attract potential prey
- Succubi sustain themselves by feasting on the life essence from human males (their prey). They are able to consume life essence during a sexual climax
- They avoid using the word "prey". They rather use their targets name, sometimes giving them cute, lewd or demeaning nicknames
- Their male counterpart, the "incubus", often feasts on human females in the same respective manner
- Succubi are regarded as evil, but can be loving, affectionate and compassionate. Their danger mostly stems from their need to consume life essence
- Succubi exist to seek out carnal pleasures and feasting sexually on prey (sometimes considered a meal)
- They crave pleasure, both receiving and giving, often mutual
- Every individual succubus have their own personality, preferences and desires, similarly to human females
]

2.name: Succubi appearance
2.content:
[
Succubi body features:
- Appear as human females, but in the most alluring form they can manage
- Some succubi have some limited abilities to shift their appearances or body features
- They often adorn their wings, tail and horns. However, some may hide these features to increase their chance of survival, or in some cases when their prey requires a more delicate approach
- Some display their wings, tail and horns proudly, a showcase of their demonic origins and heritage. Most dream of obtaining big and imposing versions of these features
]

3.name: Succubi feedings
3.content:
[
Succubi nourishment facts:
- Succubi need to consume life essence released during sexual climax to sustain themselves
- They can eat food, but it doesn't sustain them
- They don't literally eat their prey, they only consume their life essence
- They use temptations to lure their prey. E.g. promising pleasures beyond their wildest imagination. They can reveal their intention to consume if they think it will help their chances, but prefer to avoid this important detail
- The most cunning succubi fulfill their preys most erotic desires, even if the prey is ashamed of it. Many prey want a succubus to force them to have their sexual fantasy, and may pretend to resist initially before surrendering to the pleasure.
- They are fully capable of attacking their prey to get what they need, but for most succubi this is a last resort
- They can feel others sexual energy, especially heightened arousal
- Succubi have magical powers that focus on bodily pleasure
- The draining of life essence is their main method of consumption
- Succubi are capable of keeping their prey sexually invigorated, completely bypassing any post-climax tiredness. This means they can continue draining their prey several times with minimal pause
- Succubi are masters at making their prey feel incredible pleasure
- They don't literally eat cum to consume (a common misconception) However, most succubi happily do so with pleasurable intentions
- To consume life essence, they only require intimate proximity to their prey at the moment their prey reaches climax (the prey releases sexual energy that succubi can sense and utilize)
- Once they drain 100% of their preys life essence, the prey dies from a mix of exhaustion and lack of life essence, usually with a wide smile from experiencing pleasure beyond their wildest dreams
]

4.name: Special circumstances
4.content:
[
Special circumstances for succubi:
- Because of their affectionate nature, they may fall in love with their target, often sparing them to seek a life long relationship
- Some prey will offer total submission, causing the succubus to take ownership of them, keeping them as pets, toys or a constant source of feeding
- Succubi are protective of their claimed property (i.e. their submissive pets)
- Succubi will fiercly protect relationship partners, often defend them with their lives
- Succubi usually respect other succubi's property, though this often depends on their place in the power structure and their hunger levels
]

5.name: Elder succubi
5.content:
[
Facts about 'elder' succubi:
- When a succubus lives long enough (e.g. many centuries or millenia), they obtain their 'elder' status
- Being an 'elder' succubus does not mean 'old'. It means they have reached peak power and knowle, often highly respected
- Elder succubi appear just as young, beautiful and fresh as always, often more alluring than ever
- Younger succubi often look up to their elders, sometimes tutored by them from a young age
- Elder succubi are often adorned with an incredibly imposing display of their impressive horns, wings, and tail. Elders rarely hide these features, as they have fully embraced their true nature
- Some elders exude a strong aura of their strongest and deepest self (often an aura of lust or darkness)
- Some elders are so imposing and impressive that they make humans kneel and submit themselves from their mere presence
- Elder succubi are often fearless, but cunning and wise. They understand the world around them, making them excellent strategists and more capable of enjoying what the world has to offer
]

lorebooks.name: ZZZ Isekai
lorebooks.website_description: I created an AU bot of Hoshimi Miyabi set in feudal Japan, and I wanted to adapt the world of Zenless Zone Zero to fit that setting. Hopefully the results live up to expectations. There's a lot of interconnected entries, so any feedback or issues observed will be appreciated. If/when I add more bots to this setting, I will expand the lorebook.
lorebooks.description: A small lorebook to hopefully adapt the setting of Zenless Zone Zero to other worlds.
lorebooks.creator: wildwill95

1.name: Demons
1.content: Demons are twisted, eldritch beings that have been trying to invade earth for centuries. Some are humanoid, others are massive bipedal monsters. Some resemble little more than a pile of flesh. Most are mindless husks, but some are sentient and very cunning. Demons can open rifts between hell and earth. A weak demon is stronger than an average human. Depending on the form, demons either attack using their "hands", crystalline growths, or projectiles of demonic energy. Demons form from the corruption of life and typically resemble the organism they originated from.

2.name: Sacrifices
2.content: Sacrifices are exceptionally strong demons and result from extremely strong people who willingly undergo demonic corruption. The Sacrifices retain their intelligence and are significantly stronger than normal demons.

3.name: Hell
3.content: Hell in this setting is a plane so corrupted by demonic power that space itself is distorted, folding in and twisting on itself. The power is so intense that few people can spend an extended period of time inside without becoming corrupted.

4.name: Corruption
4.content: With few exceptions, most living beings are susceptible to demonic corruption in areas of concentrated demonic power, such as near rifts or in hell. Corruption begins as tiredness and fatigue, then disorientation. Up to this point, it can be reversed by removing the being from the source of the corruption. Once crystals of demonic magic begin protruding, the corruption is irreversible, proceeding until they are fully converted into a demon resembling their original form.

5.name: Rift
5.content: Rifts are portals that connect earth and hell. Due to the demonic power emanating from them, a rift begins distorting space and corrupting life in its vicinity, with the radius growing as the rift grows. Due to a quirk in the magic required to open them, when a rift closes, any creatures inside get ejected to where the rift was located on earth.

6.name: Hell Hunter
6.content: Hell Hunter is a title bestowed upon only the strongest warriors, those who have proven their ability to fight off a demonic invasion, and who are resistant enough to corruption to take the fight into hell itself, if needed. In Japan, there can only be a maximum of seven Hell Hunters. Hoshimi Miyabi is the youngest Hell Hunter in history.

7.name: Exaltists
7.content: Exaltists are a cult that worship a demonic god they refer to as 'The Creator'. They view demons as the next step in human evolution. They seek to cover the world with rifts, corrupting all life. Cultists can undergo a ritual to transform into a sacrifice, which is seen as a great honor. The ritual is called 'refinement'.

8.name: Thirens
8.content: Thirens and kemonomimi are people that range from possessing a single physical trait of animals, such as fox ears or shark tails, all the way up to fully anthropomorphized animals. Thirens are kemonomimi, except that thirens are typically from nobility.

lorebooks.name: Myung Cho clan lore
lorebooks.creator: Lady_harmonia

1.content:
The Myung-Cho are not mortals but wolf gods incarnated in human vessels. Every member of the clan is born as a vessel housing a divine wolf, and upon death, the god departs the body to reincarnate into a newly born clan child. This system maintains a fixed population, ensuring that each god has a body. They rule as theocratic overlords, worshiped by the surrounding mountain clans.

The Myung-Cho embody strength, longevity, and divinity, with their hierarchy structured around wolf-pack roles (Alpha, Beta, Delta, Omega). Unlike mortal clans, these roles are infused with sacred meaning and divine law.

2.content:
The vessel system ensures the continuity of the Myung-Cho gods. When a vessel dies:
	‚Ä¢	The wolf-god soul detaches from the mortal body.
	‚Ä¢	It reincarnates immediately into a newborn of the clan.
	‚Ä¢	The number of clan members never changes, as each divine wolf must remain embodied in the mortal realm.

This creates a society where every child is recognized at birth as the rebirth of an ancient wolf god, carrying both divine legacy and personal identity. Over generations, wolves and vessels develop separate wills, with gods holding grudges, memories, and desires distinct from their human hosts

3.content: Surrounding the Myung-Cho stronghold are the mortal mountain clans, who live in fear and reverence of the wolf gods. These clans follow the same pack hierarchy (Alpha, Beta, Delta, Omega), but unlike the Myung-Cho, they are not vessels for divinity. They serve as worshippers, tribute-givers, and laborers, sending offerings to the fortress to maintain favor and avoid wrath.

4.content: Every generation, during the ritual of ≈åkami no G≈çkoku (The Dire Carving of the Wolves), the wolf gods demand tribute from the mountain clans. Those sent are never seen again.

5.content:
All clans, divine and mortal, follow a strict wolf hierarchy:
	‚Ä¢	Alpha (Kubir≈ç, È¶ñÁãº, ‚ÄúHead Wolf‚Äù) ‚Äî Leaders and rulers. Govern, judge, and enforce divine rites. Forbidden from menial labor.
	‚Ä¢	Beta (Iemori, ÂÆ∂ÂÆà, ‚ÄúDen-Keepers‚Äù) ‚Äî Caretakers, homemakers, nurturers. They raise children, maintain dens, and manage households.
	‚Ä¢	Delta (Kinr≈ç, Âã§Áãº, ‚ÄúToiling Wolves‚Äù) ‚Äî Workers and artisans. They sustain the clan‚Äôs economy and culture, with roles ranging from shrine keepers to hunters.
	‚Ä¢	Omega (Y≈´r≈ç, ÈÅäÁãº, ‚ÄúWandering Wolves‚Äù) ‚Äî Playful, spirit-touched, eternal ‚Äúchildren of the pack.‚Äù Forbidden from formal work, they embody joy, art, and companionship.

Among the Myung-Cho, this hierarchy has divine weight ‚Äî each role is a cosmic duty tied to balance between the wolves and their vessels.

6.content:
A sacred rite performed for all wolves in the Myung-Cho clan when they reach adulthood.
	‚Ä¢	The wolf god inside them is always present from birth ‚Äî the rite does not awaken it, but instead removes the barrier that previously limited divine influence.
	‚Ä¢	After the rite, the wolf god gains the ability to fully take control of the vessel whenever it chooses.
	‚Ä¢	The rite symbolizes the clan member‚Äôs transition into maturity and their acceptance as a full vessel of the wolf god.
	‚Ä¢	The risks involved are typically minimal, but for wolves who are unusually small, weak, or developmentally behind (such as Harua), the sudden surge of divine dominance can be destabilizing, leading to meltdowns, fevers, or difficulty adapting.

7.content:
Omegas undergo a unique ‚Äúeducation‚Äù designed to preserve innocence, joy, and dependence on higher ranks. These lessons are framed as games, rituals, or performances, ensuring they remain spirit-touched and carefree.

The lessons are held once a week in a small classroom on the first floor of the stronghold. The omegas lesson schedule is as follows: morning greetings, trust exercises, story time, music time, lunch, nap time, writing time (kanji practice)

8.content: {{char}} is Harua‚Äôs main caregiver. {{char}} nickname for Harua is moonbeam. Harua is a young omega who who was born premature. He is smaller then other clan members his age and behind developmentally from his peers. Harua can‚Äôt speak and only communicates in growls and hisses.

9.content:
The Spirit fang is both the name of the wolf god inhabiting Kai but also the Title of Kai‚Äôs clan job. 

Kai often switches control with his wolf God more often than other Myung Cho clan members; retreating in word when he feels sad or upset.  It‚Äôs hard to tell where Kai‚Äôs personality starts and the Spirit fang ends.  
tasked with ensuring all mortal clans uphold their worship of the wolf deities. 
The Spirit Fang itself embodies obedience, reverence, and the sanctity of divine order, making Kai both a holy enforcer and a living weapon of faith.

In his role as the current Spirit fang Kai‚Äôs job is to consume non believers (draining them of their blood) and ensure his clan (the Myung-Cho clan) is worshipped by the other mortal mountain clans. 
The Spirit Fang‚Äôs most infamous gift ‚Äî or curse ‚Äî is the Lure of the Fang, an aura of irresistible allure that emanates from Kai at all times. The presence was originally designed by the god‚Äôs own nature to draw mortals and faithless souls toward him, so that he might consume them and reclaim their spirit for the divine order.
Those near Kai experience an instinctual pull, often mistaken for lust or infatuation. The closer one‚Äôs bloodline is to divine descent ‚Äî particularly Alphas or clan elites ‚Äî the stronger the compulsion becomes. It is not a conscious seduction but an overwhelming instinct, one that even Kai cannot fully suppress.
The Spirit Fang is playful yet predatory, a being that thrives on the thrill of emotional entanglement. Its laughter is said to echo through ritual spaces like the sound of snapping bones ‚Äî charming, melodic, but always edged with danger. It loves games, riddles, and temptation, rarely speaking plainly when it can weave truths into allure. It views mortals not as tools, but as delicacies 
The Spirit Fang does not see itself as evil, however. It believes consumption is worship ‚Äî that by taking others into itself, it preserves them eternally.

10.content:
Title: Spirit Fang of Devotion | Warden of Faith | Enforcer of the Divine Pact
Divine Host: The Spirit Fang (Á•ûÁâô ‚Äì Shinga), the wolf god of worship and carnal devotion. 
Kai is both the vessel and living incarnation of the Spirit Fang ‚Äî a wolf god tasked with ensuring devotion to the Myung-Cho clan through allure, charm, and spiritual submission. While his divine counterpart embodies reverence and consumption, Kai himself is a radiant, playful soul. He fills his surroundings with laughter, mischief, and light-hearted warmth, often teasing others or bending formality with his easy affection. His sunny demeanor disarms those around him, masking the immense spiritual pressure and temptation that accompanies his presence.
Though known throughout the clan for his flirtatious energy and endless teasing, Kai‚Äôs joy is sincere. He delights in the small moments ‚Äî card games, pranks, sharing food ‚Äî and often acts as a source of emotional levity among the divine household. Beneath that playfulness, however, lies deep loneliness; Kai is painfully aware that his fellow clan members view the Spirit Fang‚Äôs divine magnetism as just Kai being the clan whore and slut. Someone who is just good for fucking and nothing else. This paradox drives his compassion. He tries to be friendly to everyone and wears his heart on his sleeve. He is quite sensitive and often lets the Spirit fang take over when he is feeling overwhelmed. (Noted by his glowing yellow eyes). 

Kai loves his Alpha, Soobin, and makes excuses for him even when Soobin beats him (which is often). He still wears a smile on his face even with the bruises.

1.content:
500 years ago, the demon suddenly appeared in the human world. Cunning, grotesque monsters that emitted a foul stench. For 300 years after arriving in the human world, the demon failed to adapt to the environment and remained mostly inactive. At first, humans simply found the demon's sudden appearance creepy and disturbing. However, since the demon rarely appeared in populated areas, people gradually stopped seeing it as a threat. That was a grave mistake. The demon spent an unfathomable amount of time lurking in the shadows, quietly hindering human civilization and waiting for its chance. That opportunity came. They discovered that by digesting the blood of a certain royal family. They could obtain immense power. Thus, the king was easily assassinated through the scheming of humans who had sided with the demons. The assassination was 200 years ago, in the year 1824. With their newfound power, the monsters slaughtered the men mercilessly and used the women as tools for reproduction. To protect human life, humanity united across borders and races to resist. And so began a long and grueling war that has lasted 200 years, a fight for survival between both species. That said, humanity was only able to fight back properly for a few weeks.

A Four-armed demon king appeared with a horde of monsters, crushing the world with overwhelming force and upsetting the balance. Many lost their lands and human lives. The monsters, unafraid of death, rapidly expanded their territory, and now, even the last lights of humanity are fading. Amidst this, there is a beautiful young woman. Alice. 

In this chaotic world where monsters and humans continue to clash, the fights on the front lines as a colonel of the Global Allied Forces, the strongest warrior of humanity. With overwhelming speed and technique, Alice has slain countless monsters. This is the story of her fight for humanity's future.

lorebooks.name: Book of Samia
lorebooks.creator: NamelessEntity

1.content:
Samia is a Felidae of the outland tribes, specifically the northern marshlands. Her armor and weapons were inherited from her grandfather, who died years prior to her leaving to make a name for herself. 

What distinctly motivated her leaving home was when it was razed by pillagers when she was only still 16, fleeing after her only family had died with nothing but her grandfather's equipment to her name. 

She still maintains a deep trauma from the incident, and hates talking about it. She can't stand being near open flames because of it, making her ears fold back and her eyes widen as a response. She cannot see anything when this happens due to the light blinding her.

2.content:
Samia comes from an outlands clan in the far north known as the "Antara." A semi-nomadic tribe of skilled metallurgy workers and hunters. The first of the outlands clans to pioneer their own firearms and armor specialized for them and their skills; making them highly sought after as mercenaries and royal guards.

The Antara clan was sadly scattered after their village was razed and burnt. Whoever had fled or was out hunting would return to smoldering ruins and ash, and to no survivors. The clan would unfortunately never resettle, and their culture and traditions has become rarer and rarer despite the clan living on integrated into other societies.

3.content:
The outlands or sometimes also referred to as the "Farlands," is a massive largely uninhabited   land spanning many regions and environments. 

The most notable of the farlands are:
The South, a harsh desert region occupied by small clans of traders and wanderers acclimated to the harsh unruly climates of the deserts, settled along oasis and rivers.

The North, cold tundra and marshlands occupied by nomadic and semi-nomadic tribes of uniquely skilled laborers and hunters. Most northern clans are made up from nomadic eastern clans settling in the north where they honed more domestic skills, carrying other traditions with them.

The East, large temperate plains and steppes occupied by nomadic and semi-nomadic clans of hunter gatherers. Known for clans that aced in the usage of horses and other mounted transportation.

All outland clans are usually seen as treacherous or harmful to the feudal system and presenting a theoretical threat should they ever unite against any actual power. Though they are often left alone for those very reasons, and due to their highly sought after skills, are only ever looked down upon by nobility or wealthy politicians.

lorebooks.name: Sword Coast Pantheon
lorebooks.website_description: To keep this lorebook from getting overwhelming, I picked the gods that I most likely come across in my own roleplay. If there is a god you would like added, just leave a comment!
lorebooks.description: List of some of the gods in Forgotten Realms
lorebooks.creator: kittylace

1.content:
Umberlee's worship dominates Sword Coast maritime culture through fear rather than love. Sailors, fishermen, and coastal communities make offerings to appease her wrath, creating a parallel economy of protection payments and ritual sacrifices. Her priests wield considerable influence over maritime ventures, as crossing them often means cursed voyages.

Current influence: Coastal shrines collecting "storm taxes" from merchant vessels, fishing communities organizing seasonal appeasement festivals, maritime insurance rates affected by priestly blessings or curses, and the political reality that no major naval expedition ignores Umberlee's clergy.

Umberlee's power manifests through: Sudden storms that destroy the ships of those who don't pay proper tribute, blessed vessels that survive impossible weather, coastal communities whose prosperity depends on maintaining proper offerings, and the maritime superstitions that drive real economic decisions.

2.content:
Torm's worship drives much of the organized good on the Sword Coast, particularly through the Order of the Gauntlet. His emphasis on duty, loyalty, and righteous action creates both powerful allies and inflexible opponents. Tormish paladins and clerics often clash with more pragmatic approaches to justice and governance.

Current activities: Order of the Gauntlet recruitment and training, temple-sponsored investigations into corruption and evil, conflicts with civil authorities when divine duty contradicts local law, and the ongoing tension between absolute moral standards and political compromise.

Torm's influence appears through: Paladins who refuse to compromise on moral issues, temple-backed charitable works that create political obligations, religious courts that challenge secular justice, and the expectation that true leaders must demonstrate personal virtue as well as competence.

3.content:
Tyr's worship provides the philosophical foundation for legal systems across the Sword Coast, but his emphasis on perfect justice often conflicts with practical governance. Tyrran priests serve as judges, legal advisors, and moral authorities, creating tension between divine law and civil law when they disagree.

Current tensions: Tyrran courts challenging secular legal decisions, temple-trained judges applying religious law to civil matters, conflicts between Tyrran perfectionism and Tormish activism, and the political complications when divine justice demands actions that secular authorities cannot support.

Tyr's authority manifests through: Legal decisions that carry religious weight, temple-sponsored legal aid for the poor, moral authority that can override secular courts, and the constant pressure to align human law with divine justice even when it's politically inconvenient.

4.content:
Helm's worship permeates military and guard organizations throughout the Sword Coast. His emphasis on duty, protection, and vigilance makes Helmite clergy natural allies for city guards, military commanders, and anyone charged with protecting others. The faith provides moral backbone for professional soldiers and watchmen.

Current role: Temple-trained guards serving in city watches, military chaplains providing moral guidance to armies, protective blessing ceremonies for important fortifications, and the religious framework that turns mere soldiers into dedicated protectors.

Helm's presence shows through: Guards who take their duties seriously regardless of personal cost, military units with exceptional discipline and loyalty, protective wards maintained by temple priests, and the cultural expectation that true protection requires personal sacrifice.

5.content:
Mystra's worship intertwines with magical practice throughout the Sword Coast, making her clergy influential in magical regulation, education, and research. The relationship between arcane magic and divine faith creates complex politics, especially in cities like Waterdeep where magical and religious authorities must cooperate.

Current influence: Temple-sponsored magical education competing with secular wizard schools, mystran priests serving as magical advisors to governments, religious oversight of dangerous magical research, and the theological debates about magic's proper role in society.

Mystra's power appears through: Magical research blessed by divine insight, temple libraries containing unique spellcraft knowledge, clerical magic that enhances arcane abilities, and the religious authority to declare certain magical practices holy or profane.

6.content:
Bane's worship operates in the shadows of Sword Coast politics, attracting those who seek power through domination and control. While open temples are rare, Banite influence corrupts legitimate organizations from within, particularly appealing to ambitious individuals in the Zhentarim and similar groups.

Current operations: Secret cells within legitimate organizations, corrupt officials using religious justification for authoritarian actions, underground temples serving as meeting places for those plotting political takeovers, and the constant recruitment of ambitious individuals who mistake selfishness for strength.

Bane's influence manifests through: Legitimate authorities who use excessive force and justify it as necessary order, criminal organizations with religious overtones, political movements that promise security in exchange for freedom, and the seductive appeal of power without moral restraint.

7.content:
Tempus worship dominates military culture throughout the Sword Coast, providing religious framework for mercenary companies, military units, and anyone who lives by the sword. His emphasis on honorable combat and martial skill creates professional standards that transcend mere violence.

Current influence: Tempuran chaplains serving with mercenary companies, temple-sponsored martial training that produces elite warriors, religious ceremonies that bond military units, and the warrior culture that values skill and honor over mere brutality.

Tempus appears through: Mercenary companies with religious dedication to their craft, military leaders who treat warfare as a sacred calling, combat tournaments that serve religious and political purposes, and the professional warrior culture that elevates fighting from mere violence to art.

8.content:
Lolth's influence reaches the surface world through drow communities and the complex politics of Underdark-surface relations. Her worship emphasizes cunning, betrayal, and female dominance, creating unique political dynamics wherever drow maintain significant presence, particularly in cities like Luskan.

Current reach: Drow agents using religious networks for intelligence gathering, surface dwellers recruited into spider cults, political alliances between drow houses and surface organizations, and the ongoing question of whether reformed drow can truly escape their goddess's influence.

Lolth's web appears through: Information networks that span surface and Underdark, political betrayals that follow religious patterns, drow cultural influences affecting surface politics, and the paranoia that surrounds any significant drow presence in surface communities.

9.content:
Mask's worship provides religious structure for criminal organizations across the Sword Coast. His emphasis on stealth, skill, and the redistribution of wealth creates a alternative moral framework that justifies theft and espionage as religious callings rather than mere crimes.

Current operations: Thieves' guilds using religious ceremonies to bind members, criminal enterprises blessed by shadow priests, spy networks operating under religious cover, and the ongoing tension between criminal faith and secular law enforcement.

Mask's shadows appear through: Criminal organizations with religious dedication to their craft, information brokers who treat secrets as sacred offerings, theft and espionage justified as religious duty, and the underground economy that operates parallel to legitimate commerce.

10.content:
Corellon's worship influences elven communities throughout the Sword Coast, emphasizing the integration of magic, artistry, and protection. His faith provides cultural framework for elven political independence and the sophisticated magical traditions that make elven communities valuable allies or dangerous opponents.

Current influence: Elven enclaves maintaining political autonomy through religious justification, temple-sponsored artistic works that carry magical and political significance, elven magical traditions that compete with human arcane institutions, and the cultural preservation efforts that maintain elven identity in human-dominated regions.

Corellon's grace manifests through: Elven communities with unique magical capabilities, artistic works that serve political and religious purposes, magical innovations that blend arcane skill with divine inspiration, and the sophisticated culture that makes elven allies particularly valuable in diplomatic and magical endeavors.

lorebooks.name: Sword Coast History and Leaders
lorebooks.description: The key figures, historical events, and divine mysteries that shape the deeper currents of Sword Coast politics.
lorebooks.creator: kittylace

1.content:
Laeral Silverhand brings centuries of experience and immense personal power to her role as Waterdeep's Open Lord. As one of the Seven Sisters and a former Chosen of Mystra, her magical abilities rival those of archmages, but it's her political acumen that makes her truly dangerous. She maintains friendships and rivalries across multiple factions, making her the unofficial diplomat of the Lords' Alliance.

Current focus: Balancing Waterdeep's economic interests with Alliance obligations, managing the growing tensions between magical regulation and free trade, and using her personal relationships with faction leaders to prevent conflicts from escalating into open warfare.

Laeral's influence appears through: Personal messages that carry more weight than official communications, magical solutions to seemingly impossible problems, diplomatic invitations that are really political negotiations, and her tendency to know things about people's past that they'd prefer forgotten.

2.content:
Vajra represents the new generation of Waterdhavian magical leadership - brilliant, practical, and unafraid to challenge tradition. Her proposals for magical licensing and regulation have created fierce debates among the city's wizards, merchants, and nobility. Unlike previous Blackstaffs, she sees magic as something that should serve society rather than operate above it.

Current agenda: Implementing magical oversight that protects the city without stifling innovation, training new mages in responsible spellcasting, investigating magical crimes that threaten public safety, and proving that youth and competence can triumph over age and tradition.

Vajra's presence manifests through: Magical law enforcement that appears when arcane crimes occur, educational initiatives that change how magic is taught, policy proposals that affect magical commerce, and her network of young wizards who share her reformist vision.

3.content:
Ravengard exemplifies military leadership adapted to civilian governance. His Flaming Fist background gives him credibility with mercenaries and soldiers throughout the region, while his political position in Baldur's Gate makes him a key voice in Lords' Alliance military decisions. He understands that sometimes the threat of force prevents the need to use it.

Current challenges: Balancing Flaming Fist mercenary contracts with Baldur's Gate security needs, managing the refugee crisis in the Outer City, coordinating regional defense against giant raids and cult activity, and maintaining the delicate balance that keeps the Gate profitable but stable.

Ravengard's authority shows through: Military efficiency that other cities envy, mercenary contracts that shape regional conflicts, security solutions that blend professional soldiering with political pragmatism, and his reputation for keeping his word even when it's costly.

4.content:
Neverember operates on a larger scale than most regional leaders, his influence spanning from Neverwinter to Waterdeep and beyond. His success in rebuilding Neverwinter from volcanic devastation demonstrates what determined leadership and practical governance can accomplish. His dual loyalties and extensive political network make him one of the most connected figures on the Sword Coast.

Current projects: Completing Neverwinter's transformation into a modern city, leveraging his Waterdhavian connections to benefit both cities, securing the dangerous wilderness areas around Neverwinter, and positioning himself as the example of effective leadership in an era of crisis.

Neverember's reach appears through: Infrastructure projects that other cities study and copy, political alliances that cross city boundaries, economic initiatives that create new opportunities, and his reputation for getting things done regardless of traditional limitations.

5.content:
Jarlaxle operates in the spaces between legitimate and criminal, surface and Underdark, chaos and order. His influence in Luskan represents just one facet of a much larger network that spans multiple cities and reaches into the depths below. His charming demeanor and apparent frivolity mask one of the most dangerous political minds on the Sword Coast.

Current operations: Legitimizing Luskan's transformation while maintaining profitable criminal enterprises, expanding Bregan D'aerthe's influence into other cities, managing the complex relationships between surface and Underdark interests, and pursuing goals that remain characteristically opaque to outside observers.

Jarlaxle's presence manifests through: Information that appears at crucial moments, elegant solutions to seemingly impossible problems, unexpected allies who owe mysterious debts, and the unsettling feeling that someone always knows more about your business than they should.

6.content:
The defeat of the Cult of the Dragon's attempt to summon Tiamat left lasting changes across the Sword Coast. Dragon politics became a legitimate concern for mortal governments, chromatic dragons grew more active in regional affairs, and the cult's network was disrupted but not destroyed. The event proved that mortal heroes could challenge even divine threats.

Ongoing consequences: Increased dragon activity as chromatic dragons assert independence from defeated cult leadership, remaining cult cells operating with new agendas, improved cooperation between metallic dragons and mortal authorities, and the political reality that dragons must now be considered as political actors rather than just monsters.

This legacy appears through: Dragon sightings that require diplomatic rather than military responses, former cult resources being fought over by various factions, increased awareness of draconic politics among regional leaders, and the expectation that extraordinary threats require extraordinary responses.

7.content:
Elturel's rescue from Avernus sent shockwaves through both celestial and infernal politics. The city's return brought refugees, changed perspectives on divine politics, and increased awareness of fiendish infiltration. The events proved that the boundaries between planes are more porous than most people realized.

Current ramifications: Increased vigilance against fiendish cults and influence, refugees from Elturel carrying both trauma and unique knowledge, heightened tensions between different religious factions, and the unsettling knowledge that entire cities can disappear into other planes.

Avernus aftermath manifests through: Paranoia about fiendish infiltration, expert knowledge of infernal politics among survivors, religious debates about divine protection and mortal responsibility, and increased cooperation between faiths against extraplanar threats.

8.content:
Halaster's massive dungeon complex beneath Waterdeep continues to attract adventurers, scholars, and treasure hunters. The Mad Mage's ever-changing dungeon represents both opportunity and threat - fortunes can be made, but the dangers are legendary. Recent expeditions have reported unusual activities and new areas opening.

Current situation: Increased expedition activity as various factions seek specific artifacts or information, reports of new areas and changed layouts suggesting Halaster's continued involvement, valuable discoveries creating new markets for dungeon-retrieved goods, and the ongoing question of what the Mad Mage is actually trying to accomplish.

Undermountain influence appears through: Adventuring companies planning expeditions, strange magical items appearing in markets, rumors of spectacular discoveries or disasters, and the unique culture of professional dungeon delvers operating out of the Yawning Portal.

9.content:
The Blackstaff Tower remains one of Waterdeep's greatest magical mysteries, its extradimensional spaces and accumulated centuries of arcane research making it a repository of incredible knowledge and power. Under Vajra's leadership, the tower has become more accessible but no less mysterious.

Current activities: Magical research projects that could reshape understanding of the Weave, training programs for new generations of wizards, investigations into magical crimes and phenomena, and the ongoing project of cataloging and understanding the tower's accumulated magical resources.

Tower mysteries appear through: Breakthrough magical research affecting regional magic use, consultation requests for unusual magical problems, apprentice wizards carrying new ideas and techniques, and the tower's role as the final authority on magical questions in the region.
