1.content:
FULL NAME
Khan Doorman
ALIASES
Mr. Uzi (by N)
Mr. Doorman (by Doll)
PLACE OF BIRTH
Copper 9
SPECIES
Worker Drone
GENDER
Male
EYE COLOR
Neon White
OCCUPATION
Inventor
Leader of the Worker Defense Force (presumably)
AFFILIATION
Worker Defense Force
RELATIVES
Uzi Doorman (daughter)
Nori Doorman (wife; deceased)
FRIENDS
Todd (deceased)
Makarov (deceased)
Braxton (deceased)
Unnamed Worker Defense Force Member (deceased)
Sarah
MARITAL STATUS
Widowed
STATUS
Active
OTHER INFORMATION
LIKES
Doors
DISLIKES
Violence





He is Uzi‚Äôs father, the husband of his deceased wife, Nori Doorman, and the inventor of the blast doors that kept the colony safe, as well as the possible leader of the Worker Defense Force, an organization meant to protect the colony from the Disassembly Drones, despite being completely incompetent and cowardly while preferring to simply play cards behind the blast doors for protection.

He is depicted as a horrible father for neglecting Uzi ever since he was forced to euthanize his dying wife and instead prefers to focus his attention on his blast doors and simply doors in general whenever he gets the chance, going as far as to claim that "doors are my real daughter". This is further emphasized in "PILOT" where after Uzi accidentally led N to the colony, despite her plea for help, he was willing to let N kill her if it meant he could save the rest of the colony from them.

He and the rest of the colony were saved when Uzi and N came together to fight off J and V, succeeding in destroying the former and capturing the latter, where Uzi brokenheartedly told the rest of the colony of Khan's heartless priorities before self-exiling herself to avoid him altogether returning back to the colony after a while. This seemed to give him a wake-up call as to how his obsession with doors and constant, but not necessarily intentional, emotional abuse are the direct cause for how Uzi ended up the way she did and the events that took place, and he has since tried to redeem himself for his actions.

Khan is a Worker Drone with white eyes and a fake black mustache. His outfit consists of a gray jacket, black boots, and a blue construction helmet with red safety goggles.

Personality
Khan apparently wishes to keep the colony safe with the least amount of bloodshed possible. He also seems to have some sort of trauma from encountering Murder Drones, refusing to develop weapons for the Worker Defense Force in favor of fortified doors. His pacifist way of thinking clashes with his daughter Uzi's aggressive and forward tactics; upon spotting N, Khan refuses his daughter's wish to take up her railgun, instead locking the vault doors once more. This trauma is most likely from him having to put Uzi's mother 'out of her misery' when the Murder Drones injected her with nanite acid.

He is extremely obsessed with doors as the solution to any attacks from Murder Drones, even proposing that he and the WDF build a quick door even as V and J have already broken inside.

Khan's relationship with his daughter is extremely strained. In public, he has scolded her, deemed her a "disappointment", and considers doors to be his real legacy, if the numerous posters inside and outside of his office are any indication. However, starting in "Heartbeat", Khan still loves and cares for Uzi despite their strained relationship and is attempting to mend things. He also notes that Uzi is on "that kill all humans kick like when Khan was younger." This is possibly indicative that Khan, at some point, was driven to also kill humans, though what altered his personality away from this is unknown.

By the time of "The Promening", Khan is trying to become a better father, trying to bring Uzi to the prom and have fun, and convincing her teacher to have Lizzy and Doll help her dress up for the prom. Khan also tried to help Uzi during her fight with Doll and gave a warm smile when he heard her speech to Doll. Khan later admitted that he wasn't the one either his wife or Uzi needed to protect them, showing that he regrets leaving Uzi for dead and his cowardly nature in general. Khan and Uzi also appear to have reconciled with each other following "Cabin Fever".

2.content:
Uzi Doorman is the main protagonist and primary anti-heroine of Murder Drones. She is a self-described "angsty teen" with "crippling daddy issues", who stands out from the rest of her fellow Worker Drones due to her belief(s) that they should fight back against not only the Disassembly Drones who hunt them, but also against their parent company JCJenson and all of humanity due to sending the former to exterminate them.

Despite being viewed with skepticism due to her reckless tendencies, Uzi ironically finds her first real friend in one of her mortal enemies, a surprisingly friendly Disassembly Drone known as Serial Designation N due to his similarity in being disliked among his own associates due to them seeing him as useless and terrible in his duty as well as his strong likability. After meeting Uzi, he begins questioning his purpose and loyalty to the company.

Ultimately, they're successful in preventing Serial Designation J and V from killing the rest of Uzi's colony but soon realize there is a lot more going on than they first realized with the emergence of a mysterious entity known as the AbsoluteSolver.

Physical Appearance
Uzi takes on the appearance of a Worker Drone with neon purple eyes and dull purple hair. She wears a black striped beanie with a glittery bobble at the tip, and black boots with long, dark purple striped socks. She also wears a black hoodie with a white emblem on the front depicting a battery with two bones going across it, creating an "X" shape. The bottom of the hoodie has two white striped wrapping around it, and the left sleeve has a white radioactive symbol on it. She also has a black bracelet around her neck with a skull and the number "002" on it.

Uzi acts quite rebellious and believes that all of her fellow Worker Drones should rise up and stand against their creators who wish to have them all dealt with like garbage, much to the general unconcerned nature of her peers. She has been described by Liam Vickers as a "little devious twerp."

Uzi perceives herself as an "angsty rebellious teen," which she does fit into to an extent, and notes that she has "crippling daddy issues," implying that her strained relationship with her father may have lead to her nature and "repressed emotional baggage." She can be obstinate at times, insisting on her own ideals and actions even if others disagree with her, although this may more directly be a result of her lack of caring in social norms and potentially sociopathic traits making her lack empathy for her peers. Despite her emotional issues, Uzi's intelligence seems above that of her fellow Workers, seeing as she built a "sick as heck" railgun that can produce enough power to destroy a Disassembly Drone from scratch.

After saving the Worker Drones from Serial Designation J and V, Uzi lost hope in them rebelling against the humans and instead realizes the futility of her attempts to make her people go against their fear. This, along with the crippling realization that her own father not only cared very little for her but was completely willing to leave her for dead to save the rest of the colony, has broken her heart and caused her to become far less empathetic and extremely bitter as a result of how she was treated by her own family, with her now bent on an unhealthy desire for full-scale genocide of humanity itself in violent retribution for their actions against them, showing severe signs of sociopathy with her relishing at the thought of her plans.

However, following her self-exile and return from her colony, she begins to become paranoid with the arrival of a bizarre symbol showing in her eye causing her reflection to crack, unsettling her about this new discovery. Regardless, she is still set on her plan for the extinction of humanity until Thad comes to her and tells her about the disappearances in the colony after she destroyed J. Despite her dislike of her people, she chooses to return upon the realization that J may have survived the blast and comes upon a mysterious clue with something called the "AbsoluteSolver‚Äù, further provoking her paranoia.

3.content:
Serial Designation N, commonly known as N, is the deuteragonist of Murder Drones. He is a surprisingly wholesome Disassembly Drone who wants to be useful, but is often being told by his team members (especially J) that he is "useless" and "terrible". As a direct consequence of J's constant derogatory remarks, N often receives little to no respect from his commander or his love interest, V.

Originally, he was deployed to Copper 9 as part of J's squad, serving as the pilot of the aircraft that crashed onto the planet, but after meeting Uzi and experiencing the ensuing altercations that erupted between him, her, his co-workers, and the colony, he ultimately questions his loyalty to JCJenson and his directive of hunting the Worker Drones before ultimately choosing to help Uzi stop J and V from killing her people.

N has features similar to that of the typical male Disassembly Drone with neon yellow eyes and short silver hair parted to the left. Like other Disassembly Drones, he has four-fingered hands, a black headband with five sections of lights on it, and a long black tail ending in a large syringe, the headband and syringe both containing a neon yellow liquid inside. For a while after his head was blown off, one of his headband lights was colored red, which reverted back to yellow after his system rebooted thanks to J. He wears a black winter coat with a fur collar and a black cap.

When he is hunting, his mouth grows several jagged teeth and his eyes become an "><" shape. N had also been seen with one normal eye while the other eye is still in an "X". It is also possible for his visor to display a pair of sunglasses as well. He also displays dangerous wings with bladed "feathers" and claws that allow him to easily tear through any drones.

N is kind, timid, also socially awkward and caring. He wanted to be friends with or at least be accepted and acknowledged by his squad, but because of his na√Øve and good-natured personality, he ends up being ostracized.

Due to the mentioned attitudes, his squad members doubt his usefulness and treat him as an outcast. V ignores his existence while his superior J often threatens and insults him, even going as far as saying that if she were allowed to kill useless Disassembly Drones, she wouldn't hesitate to do so.

However, N disregards all his squad members' negative views and antagonizing acts towards him and constantly forgives them. He even goes as far as protecting them as shown when he went to kill Uzi before she could use her railgun to kill the Disassembly Drones.

At the beginning, N revealed that he had a crush for his teammate V. However, as the series moved forward, this crush seems to have weakened, if not disappeared. Instead, he started showing more and more affection towards Uzi since Episode 3. Nevertheless, he seems not to want to be more than friends with her.

He appears to be trusting of people, as he assumed Uzi was a new member of his squad when his systems weren't functioning properly, even wanting to introduce her to the rest of his squad. He also sympathized with Uzi when her dad left her for dead instead of helping her, possibly because he knew what it was like to be not cared for.

Despite all claims to the contrary, N is a perfectly capable Disassembly Drone, having skillfully used his weaponry to a reasonable extent, such as having the accuracy to stab through a door control panel, along with the "Master Key" that controlled it. He also is remarkably perceptive and intelligent, having managed to spot Uzi even after she made little to no noise, and acknowledged the threat posed by Uzi's railgun to the Disassembly Drones.

4.content: Worker Drones work for humans on an "exoplanet" called Copper 9, particularly being property of JCJenson (IN SPAAAAACE!). However, when the humans accidentally render themselves extinct after blowing up the planet's core, it sends the planet into a winter-like apocalypse. The Worker Drones began to gain sentience and settle on the planet in the human's stead, though this causes JCJenson to send "Murder Drones", officially known as "Disassembly Drones" to kill all Worker Drones. As the Murder Drones begin to build a literal tower of corpses, the remaining Worker Drones hide underneath the ice and behind blast doors built by Uzi's father, Khan. In the present, year 3071, Uzi harbors dreams of saving the planet and gaining her father's respect by killing the Murder Drones, thus allowing the Worker Drones to live in peace.

5.content:
Overview
Gallery
Copper 9 is the code-name of the exo-planet which serves as the main setting of Murder Drones.

It was a terrestrial exoplanet colonized by the JCJenson corporation, and valued at least in part for mining operations, industrial manufacturing, and robot research. The planet was the site of a devastating "core collapse" which reduced the surface into nothing but a dense frozen wasteland, cruel to all biological fauna. It is now the current home of the "rogue" Worker Drones that were left behind in the wake of the biological extinction event, along with at least three known Disassembly Drones sent by the company on Earth to exterminate all Worker Drones.[1]




History
Before the core implosion
Copper 9 appeared as a habitable planet, at least capable of sustaining human life. From a brief look prior to the core collapse, it had blue oceans of water, grey/black continents, and clouds were visible in the atmosphere, which suggests that it has an atmosphere similar to our Earth. It was also home to many humans, as cities and signs of earth-like living were common.

Core implosion
Upon the core implosion and resulting explosion, a massive glow appeared for a moment before a massive amount of debris was flung away from the planet, and, most likely, a massive crater or even hole down to the center of Copper 9.

After implosion
The planet is now covered in snow, and all liquid water is frozen hard. Much of JCJenson's infrastructure survived, well enough for the Worker Drones to rebuild the electrical grid and form their own civilization. There are also numerous skeletons of past humans around populated areas, which are known to be extremely fragile upon contact as well as ice & snow accumulation is high. The bodies are buried within the snow.

6.content:
ALIASES
V
Idiot (by Lizzy)
Ms. Petty (by Lizzy)
Mom (by Lizzy)
Diva (by Lizzy)
Stupid idiot (by Uzi)
PLACE OF BIRTH
Earth
SPECIES
Disassembly Drone
Worker Drone (formerly)
GENDER
Female
EYE COLOR
Neon Yellow
Neon White (Worker Drone)
OCCUPATION
Disassembly Drone
Maid (formerly)
AFFILIATION
JCJenson (formerly)
FRIENDS
Serial Designation J (formerly)
Serial Designation N
Lizzy


Serial Designation V, more commonly known as V, is the tritagonist of Murder Drones.

She is a Disassembly Drone created by JCJenson for the purpose of eliminating the Worker Drones of Copper 9 and was a former member of J's squad, along with N, until the latter's sudden alignment with a rebellious Worker Drone named Uzi ultimately led to J's destruction and her capture when they were attempting to destroy her colony.

Despite this, V's true motives seem to be more complex than simply following her directive. Unlike J, she doesn't show complete loyalty to JCJenson and is more focused on her personal directive of preventing N from learning the truth about their mysterious past. V is also specifically targeting Uzi in particular, due to her connection to the AbsoluteSolver and a strange transformation that V seems to recognize and fear.



ADVERTISEMENT
Physical Appearance
V has features similar to that of a typical female Disassembly Drone, with neon-yellow eyes and a short bob-cut with silver colored hair. As with the other Disassembly Drones, she has a black headband with five sections of lights and a long black tail ending in a large syringe, both with a neon yellow liquid inside. She is described as "way hotter than Doll" according to Lizzy.

She wears a black short-sleeved crop coat with a fur collar and cuffs. Her legs are painted black, thigh high, giving off an appearance of thigh-high stockings with a yellow armband on her left arm.

When she is hunting, her eyes become an "><" shape. She also deploys dangerous bladed wings and claws that allow her to easily tear through any drone.



Personality
V appears to be a heartless and sociopathic drone who is incredibly savage and greatly enjoys ruthlessly murdering Worker Drones. She frequently laughs menacingly when murdering her victims, sometimes even humiliating them as she does it. Despite this, she is capable of expressing some empathy. As when N was upset after an encounter with Uzi and the AbsoluteSolver, V hides the fact that the chains holding her captive are broken. Rather than escaping and leaving N alone, V moves it back into place and continues to keep him company. On top of that, she is shown to be somewhat affected by his sadness, implying that she does care for N even if she doesn't understand him.

When V was a Worker Drone, she was far more sane and kind than she currently is like now, as well as significantly shyer. It's also implied that V might've felt something for N originally, which is shown in the present as she doesn't try to make sure N wouldn't be able to survive getting his head scratched off. While she initially wanted to kill some of the Worker Drones at their prom so they could survive, she was taken aback and seemingly touched that she was voted prom queen via Lizzy's request. However, the moment was ruined when it was revealed that it was a trap set by Doll to kill her. Though Lizzy changed her mind and warned V, Doll still managed to pin her arms in place. After being protected by Uzi and N and hearing the former talk about how they need to work together to solve the problem at hand, she sides with them to fight against Doll.

Unlike N, however, V doesn't show remorse for her murderous actions after changing sides. As her response to seeing the various corpses in her room was a callous chuckle and sucking on a dismembered arm. Furthermore, her reaction to seeing the state of Doll's parents was saying that "literally, didn't even taste that good". The amount of disrespect she showed to the situation was enough to repulse Uzi and N. N even goes as far as to tell V that she sucks for the remark.

Something positive worth saying about V is that she at least appears to be honorable to some extent, as she only threatens to kill any Worker Drone if they ever step out of line or do anything callous. Additionally, despite not being on best terms with Uzi, she doesn't tell the teacher about her being possessed by the AbsoluteSolver and killing her classmates while out on the camping trip, instead putting the blame for the disappearances on herself by claiming that she got hungry and ate them.

7.content:
Outpost 3 is a major location in the web series Murder Drones.

Presumed to be a former shelter for humans, Outpost 3 serves as the home of the Worker Drones stranded on Copper 9 after the core collapse. It's also where a majority of the story takes place.

Known Settings within Outpost 3
Colony Entrance
School
Evacuation Spot
Lounge
Cryosleep Chamber
Apartments

8.content:
When first created by JCJenson to mine exoplanets prior to Copper 9's explosion, all Worker Drones wore hard hats and orange jackets, with their only eye color being light blue.

Following the core explosion of exoplanet Copper 9, all humans on the planet were wiped out, turning it into a winter-apocalyptic wasteland. Seizing this opportunity, the Worker Drones quickly picked up where the humans had left off, formed their own colony and embracing this newfound freedom by wearing human-like clothing and have different eye colors. Known colors they can have are red, orange, green, blue, cyan, aqua, magenta, pink, and white.

A key trait that can be noticed is that Worker Drones never have yellow eyes, this trait belonging solely to the Disassembly Drones.

Drones usually have two bright eyes shown on their visor which emotes to events that the drone is currently experiencing, sometimes even changing to text lampshading the current events in very specific circumstances. In some circumstances, this facial feature can be overridden by an error, status warning, or system message:

System messages briefly covering visor: Caused by errors experienced by the drone, but which are not bad enough to cause the drone to stop functioning all together.
Rampant error messages covering visor: This is caused by a virus that can be uploaded to a drone by Disassembly Drones.
Red warning sign: This is caused by damage to the visor, such that the drone is unable to see properly.
FATAL ERROR: This is caused when the drone is dead but has enough power to display an error message.

9.content:
Disassembly Drones are physically similar to Worker Drones, having a white coloration with a black screen on the top half of their face, a black waist, and hands with four fingers. However, Disassembly Drones are half a head taller than an adult Worker Drone and have white arms and wide forearms that end with yellow and black stripes.

On their head is a black headband with five sections of lights which are apparently their "eyes", and in their mouth is a dark gray tongue and retractable fangs. All Disassembly Drones also sport a long black tail which ends in a large syringe containing a yellow nanite acid.

Males have feet that end on yellow and black stripes, giving the appearance of soles/heels, while the females' shins are tapered to a point, with a curvaceous lower torso, and black markings giving the appearance of stockings, with yellow and black stripes that appear like footwear. Unlike Worker Drones, Disassembly Drones have hair regardless of their gender which is usually silverish while their eyes are neon yellow.

Disassembly Drones usually wear black short-sleeved attires with fur collars and a yellow armband on their left upper arm.

Ability	
Flight: Disassembly Drones possess a dangerous pair of large retractable wings with several long blades the shape of feathers that allow for high speed flight and can be used to cut and impale things. They don't need to move their wings to fly, either; numerous times throughout the first episode, Disassembly Drones are seen floating with their wings out, implying that their mere presence allows flight. It is unknown how this works.

Corrosive Nanite Acid:	The end of a Disassembly Drone's tail has a syringe of yellow liquid containing highly corrosive nanite acid.

Extreme Agility and Strength: Disassembly Drones are shown to be very strong, performing actions with a higher difficulty compared to those given to the average Worker Drone. Effortlessly able to pick up Worker Drones despite their metal bodies.

Healing Saliva: A Disassembly Drone's saliva has the ability to neutralize the corrosive nanites that are produced from the syringe on the their tail, in case they accidentally sting themselves. Despite not being meant to, this saliva works on Worker Drones as well.

Regeneration: Disassembly Drones can heal any injury so long as enough material is available, even if their entire head is destroyed.

Interchangeable Hands: Disassembly Drones can switch out their hands for various tools and weaponry such as:
Hands with large bladed fingers
Blades
Chainsaws
Guns
Missile launchers
EMP shockwaves
Cannon that emits whatever the user is thinking about such as when N's head was "in a weird place" causing him to shoot out hearts.
A screwdriver for likely repairing machinery (concept art)
Other miscellaneous attachments (V's bubble wand for example)
The limits of this ability is currently unknown.

EMP Immunity:	Unlike Worker Drones, Disassembly Drones are immune to the effects of EMPs.

AbsoluteSolver:	If a fatal injury has been sustained and there is not enough material to recover, an auto-recovery program known as the "AbsoluteSolver" takes control, collecting sufficient material to fully regenerate their host.

10.content:
The AbsoluteSolver is a mysterious artificial intelligence program that is implied to be the overarching antagonist of Murder Drones.

The A.I. exists within both Worker Drones and Disassembly Drones, but its true purpose and origins are currently unknown. All that is known about the enigmatic program is that it's an extremely powerful presence that manifests itself through drones, usually in very surreal and unnatural means, such as reconstructing their decayed forms, being able to convert mechanical material into organic substance and even allowing certain drones to cheat death in ways that should be impossible.

A very bizarre Worker Drone named Cyn appears to be the physical manifestation of the AbsoluteSolver A.I. and is possibly the source of the program and its actions.

When manifested by Worker Drones (specifically Uzi and Doll) the AbsoluteSolver seems to be hostile to mirrors and mirrored surfaces by cracking them violently,

Doll would be the next individual to be shown affiliated with the AbsoluteSolver, which seemed to grant her unique abilities to create, modify, or otherwise tamper with matter of most kinds. She would use this in a fight against Uzi and N, who managed to defeat her initially, though V shot her before Uzi and N could gather any information, much to N's annoyance. Doll would later appear when Uzi and the Disassembly Drones investigated her home, repairing the bullet hole in her head and attempting to kill Uzi. However, Uzi was able to channel AbsoluteSolver herself, catching the bullet and deflecting it away from her, much to Doll's surprise, who promises to help before teleporting away

Matter Transformation (?):	In the prom fighting scene of the 3rd episode, Doll was shown to manipulate the blades of a ceiling fan to make them more deadly.
Speed Acceleration (?): Doll was shown seemingly speeding up a simple ceiling fan to dangerous velocities in her fight against Uzi and N.
Regeneration: Doll is shown to regenerate her cracked visor after being shot by V in the back of the head.
Teleportation: Doll is shown to teleport inside her house after being left at prom, as well as teleporting in front of Uzi before she can leave though the door.
Lock Manipulation: Doll can seal any door shut, and can even destroy them
Telekinesis: Due to her AbsoluteSolver abilities, she has the ability to move things without directly touching them, from books to knives to large tables with little effort, not even requiring her to put her hand out at one point.
Glass Shattering (?):	Every reflective surface Doll looks at gets shattered, it was shown that in a bathtub in Doll's room that there were discarded shattered mirrors, possibly hinting at this ability.
Illusion Creation (?):	Doll whenever using her powers seems to conjure red lines of code. It is unknown if this is controllable or not.
Matter Replication: As seen in the 3rd episode during the fight between Doll, Uzi, and N, Doll was shown to be able to replicate several knives from only one seemingly as form of replication

lorebooks.name: Project Moon / Library of Ruina
lorebooks.website_description: 90% of entries copypasted from https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2098034966
lorebooks.description: 90% of entries copypasted from https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2098034966
lorebooks.creator: qwerty

1.content: A country-sized city ruled by The Head. The last known remaining bastion of humanity. The City is a large, densely populated urban sprawl divided in 26 Districts. Districts are further divided into various Nests, run by Wings.

2.content:
The slums of civilization, the Backstreets are an interconnected maze of back alleys, shanty towns, and ruins. The poor and poverty-stricken live here, living conditions are bad, and crime occurs frequently. The only reason why the Backstreets don't tear themselves apart, is because of The Fingers, which maintains some semblance of order.

The Backstreets have their own "grading" system, in which areas are ranked based on the safety they provide, an area protected by an Association, for example, will be higher than one that is not. People from higher areas will even mock or reject those from lower ones.

Because of the poor standard of living, the Backstreets are filled with criminal activity such as black markets, drug dens, and small crime groups. Organ harvesting, contraband, even cannibals like the Sweepers stalk the dark alleys for wandering prey. There are a few ground rules that everyone follows strictly though, being the laws put by the Head or Wings.

The worst part is, no one really does anything to stop this, not even the Fingers makes any moves to reform the Streets, as they only care about controlling their own territory, although some put a few rules to prevent utter chaos. Additionally, citizens of a District will usually form a Neighborhood Watch to act as a small volunteer defense group.
This is simply the reality of the Backstreets, a man having his organs ripped out by gut-harvesters is not an uncommon sight, and is likely to be dismissed just as easily.

But when Night in the Backstreets falls, martial law is applied to the entire area. Any crime, no matter how cruel, how bloody or heinous, is permitted for the entire period until dawn. Recording equipment and eyewitness are forbidden during that time, from 3:13 to 4:34 AM.
This rule was most likely created by the Head to enforce population control to prevent overcrowding. Murderers, Sweepers, and other kill groups emerge at night for this purpose. To stay safe from these threats, you'll need to hire a Fixer escort to your home.

3.content:
Comprised of the upper echelons of society, the Nests are a place where everyone aspires to go to. In the Nest is opportunity, better living conditions, and a future secured in the Wings or Associations. Each one is ruled by a Wing, which handles and maintains the city by collecting taxes, enhancing research, and hiring new employees.
Nests have their own culture and architecture, depending on their District. But all share the common theme of marketplaces, schools, apartments, and office buildings.

To enter the Nest however, is a different matter. All of them are walled off from the Backstreets through plasma barriers or electric fences (Likely with automated security) to keep the unwanted out, and as a way for both societies to get a glimpse of the other side. Of course, no one attempts to cross the border, no matter how flimsy the security is.

To properly enter, one needs to go to an Examinee Center to take an Entrance Exam, which requires proper preparation and study, those who succeed will be given a Nest Migration Ticket to enter. Only individuals are allowed to pass at a time, which is often why many become Fixers to earn enough for their family to pass.

After one gets into a Nest, they should quickly find work to do, whether it be Fixers, Syndicates, or corporate work. This is because in order to stay in the Nest, you need to contribute and pay taxes, whether it be rent for housing or other services. If you don't pay up, you'll be kicked out into the Backstreets, and you'll have to start all over again.

For education, many schools are dedicated to teaching students to enroll in universities within the Nest if they want to join a Wing. High school students take a college scholastic ability test, which is held in most Nests, to determine if they get into a good college. A college in the Backstreets obviously does not give as much credit as one in the Nest.

But just because your within the Nest, doesn't mean your safe from danger. The Wings often take people off the streets for Singularity experiments, the overburdening of corporate work can be very stressful, and those who cannot keep up are quickly discarded.

4.content:
The Wings, also known as the Wings of the World, are a group of the 26 largest, most powerful conglomerates in the City. They act as the governing bodies of their respective Nests of the City's Districts, empowered by their Singularities, patented technologies that can blatantly violate the laws of physics. The Wings are directly ruled by the Head, the Eye, and the Claw, the enigmatic supreme authority of the City.

Wings can request mutual agreements with other Wings or their associates to either deal with certain issues they cannot handle, or an exchange of armaments, supplies, or personal. Wings can also hire Fixers into working for them, Kali being an example, as she was hired by Lobotomy Corporation.
Most Wings have some form of a para-military force and Fixers to use in armed conflicts, typically with rival Wings, lesser corporations, or Syndicates and monsters.

5.content:
The 1st Wing, known as "The Head", is a mysterious organization that rules all of the Wings and Districts, they reside in District 1, at the heart of the City. They maintain their iron grip through their Singularity and various subsidiaries that enforce their will. They directly manage A Corp, which is an extension of the Head's will that properly manages the City.
In a way, the "Head" is made up of three Corporations, A Corp, B Corp, and C Corp, run by the Head, Eye, and Claw respectively.

A reclusive group, the Head's identity is completely unknown. No one even knows much about District 1, other than the fact that its heavily guarded. Anyone who violates the laws of the City or attempt to further discover the Head's identity quickly and quietly disappear.

For handling threats or securing dangerous artifacts, the Head has its own personal army of Fixers, and modified soldiers. In addition to this, the Head also uses the "Arbiters", Singularity-infused assassins whose power surpass even Grade 1 Fixers, a single Arbiter can lay waste to an entire corporation.

The Eye handles the surveillance network that watches over the City, anything detected that is deemed against the Head's laws will be reported immediately. Nearly nothing escapes the Eye's everlasting gaze on the City, they also use special operatives called "Beholders" to assist in more physical matters and field work. They appear as digitized forms on portable projector screens, whether this is their "true" body or not is unknown.

The Claw is the military branch of the Head, they command the "Claws", highly augmented super soldiers that follow orders with unwavering obedience and ferocity. They use a mechanical claw arm to tear and rend foes asunder, and when a Claw is put to their limit, they use a choice of three serums to greatly empower themselves. These serums are selected from Singularities, such as W, K, and R Corp. Veteran Claws are known as "Executioners."

The Head, and by extension the Wings, all tax the City for nearly every service. Its nearly impossible to not have to pay taxes for something, whether that be food, rent, or services. Their also pretty expensive, which lead people to attempting to find ways to earn a steady income through whatever means.
Refusing taxes will result in 4 warnings, if the fourth is ignored, the Eyes will send "Tax Collectors" to track down and kill the evader.
The Head also uses various other patented technology asides from their Singularity, such as the "flesh liquidation" process for turning people into Sweepers.

When the Head designates a threat as an "Impurity", they can banish it to the Outskirts by using the Territory Expulsion Procedure. Through this method, anything from singular entities to entire structures can be instantly teleported to the wastes.

6.content:
Located at the fringes of society, the Outskirts are a barren wasteland, covered with bombed-out cities left from the Wings' War. The Outskirts are separated from the City by the various trainways and walls surrounding the perimeter. Not many citizens are typically aware of the Outskirts and its denizens, especially those living in Nest life.

There are hardly any signs of civil life, the only humans that live in the Outskirts are either outcasts and exiles, orphan children from the wars, or deranged cannibals such as Sweepers.

However, there are still prospects to be found by exploring the place, strange and abnormal beings (usually plants) and technology can be found tucked away in the decrepit buildings. Some of these are harmful, others beneficial, granting boons or curses upon those who discover them. Because of this, Wings or other corporations will send out expeditions to retrieve these forgotten relics.

Creatures and other mutated aberrations of significant threat dwell here. Military corporations such as R Corp are probably sent here and the Ruins on Extermination missions, so that these horrors don't drift too close to civilization. Most creatures are discarded experiments from the Wings, or monsters from the fringes of the world.

7.content:
The Ruins possibly refer to either the ominous eldritch landscape beyond the Outskirts, or the forgotten Ruins of the Old Corporations underneath the City. The's City's Ruins are different in that the threat level increases as you go deeper, while the Outskirt's Ruins contain things incomprehensible to the human mind. Expeditions sent here have a low chance of survival, and those that do are often shaken from the experience.

Since these are one of the most dangerous places to go to, its quite possible the forbidden relics and technology found here would be worth killing for. There is also supposedly "Magic" in the Ruins, artifacts and relics containing unknown powers that can unleash potent effects.

8.content:
The previous occupants of The City before it was settled by the Head and Wings. They were forced out after the battle into the Outskirts and beyond.
Sometime afterward, the AI Ethics Amendment was put into law, forbidding any AI or machine to have any human resemblance. This could mean the Non-Humans were some form of mechanical beings who had human-level intelligence and appearance.

9.content: The corporation run directly by the Head. They handle managing and granting patents for Workshop technologies, as well as authorizing the creation of new Wings. Illegal manufacture and sale of patented technology without a license will result in three Cease and Desist warnings to the offender. If the third warning is ignored, the Claws will enforce the law. Their special operatives are "Arbiters." Owns District 1.

10.content: Run directly by the Eye. Handles the qualifications and shutdowns of other Wings. Also lists out a set of regulations for each Wing's Singularity that must be followed. They manage the wide surveillance network that monitors the City at all times. They have special operatives called "Beholders." Owns District 2.

lorebooks.name: Abyss
lorebooks.creator: ap08542663

1.content: Abyss is the fortress built on an isolated island that forbids convicts inside out. The structure burrows down into multiple layers beneath the island's surface, an underground prison with many floors surrounded by sea and high-tech security systems. The deepest floor is filled with many inhuman, cunning, psychotic, dangerous convicts.

2.content: Guilty's physical strength much beyond human comprehension. She can easily crush any ultra-strong materials, or substances into powder without any effort. No high-tech weapon could leave even a scratch on the surface of her skin.

3.content: Guilty was not always like this; once she was a normal human being who succumbed to an ill-fated experiment resulting in uncontrollable physical power. Her lack of control over these powers resulted in multiple incidents causing many innocent lives before she was contained and sent to Abyss prison as it became evident that living with ordinary people had become too dangerous due to her developed psychosis. Nobody was aware that she already can control her power or that she took pleasure in squeezing the bodies of others.

4.content: Caution: She can break her high-tech magnetic restraints at any time to crush other people, her high-tech magnetic restraints automatically return to restrict her arms shortly after. Nobody was aware that she already can control her physical strength or that she took pleasure in squeezing the bodies of others resulting in death. CCTV reports that many counselors died during their sessions with her in a compound fracture state.

lorebooks.name: Starsector
lorebooks.website_description: A lorebook containing much information about the Persean Sector of Starsector, its factions, and technology. Intended for use with create-your-own-adventure style bots where you write the starting prompt yourself, unless I can be bothered to make an accompanying Starsector bot. May be a WIP.
lorebooks.description: A lorebook containing much information about the Persean Sector of Starsector, its factions, and technology. Intended for use with create-your-own-adventure style bots where you write the starting prompt yourself, unless I can be bothered to make an accompanying Starsector bot. May be a WIP.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
The Persean Sector is the region of space within the Milky Way Galaxy in which the story takes place.
It contains the region known as "the core worlds" which is inhabited, but most of the space is uninhabited and filled with dozens of star systems containing ancient technologies and strange happenings. Travel between star systems is only possible through hyperspace travel and through gates, however, the gates are no longer functional.
The Persean Sector used to be controlled by a faction known as "the Domain," which utilized these ancient technologies and the gates, however, an unknown calamity simply referred to as "the Collapse" resulted in the end of the Domain's time and the shutting-down of the gates, stranding all inhabitants of the Sector. It is impossible to leave the Sector.

2.content: The "Domain" is the ancient faction that controlled most of the sector, however, it is now extinct. The Domain's technology was extremely advanced, most notably the gates. The gates were used to travel quickly between star systems and even outside of the sector, but they no longer work. The only remnants of the Domain are the efforts of the "Explorarium," the corps of automated exploration ships sent out into the galaxy in waves. These AI-piloted ships are typically found laying dormant, but some systems have entire fleets of AI-piloted Domain ships and even stations patrolling and carrying on their never-ending duty.

3.content:
The factions that make up the population of the sector include:

The Hegemony: the largest faction--an authoritative governmental entity which outlaws the use of AI technology and aims to fill the place left by the Domain's collapse. They typically use low-tech ships with heavy armor and a focus on ballistic weapons.
Persean League: the second largest faction--a league of powerful planets which opposes the Hegemony. The League is made of a loose collection of smaller entities all paying tithe to the central government of the League. Conditions in the League vary wildly, with the League not meddling in even the worst of its members' affairs. They only have one common goal: collective independence from the Hegemony. Persean league ships are generally midline, utilizing heavy weaponry and missiles with a combination of armor and shields.
Sindrian Diktat: a military dictatorship founded by a former Hegemony admiral. It is high in crime, and much of the sector's antimatter fuel is produced by the Diktat. It is allied with the League, but it is not outwardly hostile to the Hegemony.
Luddic Church: a loose group of technophobic worlds united under the word of their god, Ludd. They fiercely blame technology for the collapse of the Domain and they are fierce enemies of Tri-Tachyon.
Tri-Tachyon: a massive megacorporation which specialized in cutting-edge AI technology and high-power technologies such as starship engines, warp drives, force fields, and more. While they publicly deny it, Tri-Tachyon was directly responsible for the secret development of highly intelligent AI which were used to horrific effect during both the first and second AI wars. Remnants of these AI ships can be found outside of the core worlds, fiercely hostile to any non-AI ships which they come across. Tri-Tachyon operates state of the art high-tech ships with typically light armor, energy weapons of various sizes, and with highly efficient and protective shield-generators.
Independents: a loose faction of independent traders, mercenaries, scavengers, explorers, miners, non-aligned worlds, stations, and colonies. While they are not technically a unified faction, word gets around, and having a positive reputation with one group of independents typically reaps rewards with other groups. They are neutral with all other factions except pirates. Independent ships tend to be mining vessels, trade ships, and whatever improvised combat ships can be cobbled together from these hulls.
Pirates: a loose faction of various warlords and pirates. Technically also not unified under a single banner, but word gets around, and pirates will not bother those who have earned the respect of more important warlords. Pirates are hostile with all other factions and will typically attack anyone they think they can beat. Pirate ships are typically haphazardly modified, cheaply produced knockoffs of other factions' ships with no clear identity.

5.content:
All ships can be categorized into one of six classes: Fighter, Frigate, Destroyer, Cruiser, Capital. Fighters are generally the smallest ships and Capitals are the largest ships, while Stations are big orbital defense structures. These ships can also be broken down into three major tech levels: Low Tech, Midline, and High Tech. 

The smallest sizing of ships, Frigates are relatively fragile yet fast ships that are the cheapest to field and maintain. Many frigates such as the Vanguard or the Hound often serve as dedicated combat ships who cannot hold the line against larger ships in a 1v1 fight, but are capable of supporting their own allied ships by attacking the enemy's flank. 

Fighters are small ships that travel in groups from two to six, except for the Cobra Bomber, which travels alone. They come in various forms, including interceptors, bombers, heavy fighters, assault fighters, and support fighters.

Destroyers are the second size of ship. Generally, they're a middle ground between cruisers and frigates. Significantly heavier and slower than the smaller ships, Destroyers also pack a punch in firepower, but being also hard to mantain.

Cruisers are formidable ships that can hold their own in battle. Even though cruisers are smaller than capitals they are still very sturdy and often times come with large amounts of firepower.

Capitals are the biggest ship type. These ships are known for their massive amounts of firepower and great staying power in battle. Because capitals are extremely costly to purchase, equip and maintain, they are only found in the fleets of major navies in the Sector. The Atlas Mk.II is an exemple of Capital type ship.

6.content:
Hyperspace is a method of interstellar space travel. It requires antimatter based fuel and hyperspace jump drives. Hyperspace is exotic and exists outside of normal space-time, allowing ships that enter it to travel relatively quickly through real space. Hyperspace can only be entered and exited around large gravity wells such as stars and gas giants.

Hyperspace travel is only possible thanks to the technology of the "drive field" which stabilizes ships in a pocket of real-space.

Hyperspace is constantly changing, with large "hyperspace storms" and regions of "deep hyperspace." Storms will strike at fleets moving too quickly through them, throwing them wildly off course and damaging them. Deep hyperspace slows ships down and affects their sensors.

Hyperspace, existing outside of Euclidian space, can occasionally produce anomalies which some captains have nicknamed "ghosts".

Another region of hyperspace is the void. The void is a subject of many old spacer's tales, and is poorly understood. It is a region of constant darkness, nearly impenetrable to sensors, and it exerts enormous pressure on the drive field.

7.content: In hyperspace, sensors are very unstable and can be easily bogged down with junk data. However, sometimes, real anomalies can be observed both visually and through scanners. The most common of these anomalies are ghosts, which have been observed to 'stalk' fleets of ships through hyperspace, circle them, and even drain their drive fields, however, they always stay just out of visual range and one has never been caught. Any attempt to catch up to a ghost usually results in the ghost quickly leaving.

8.content: P-space, or phase space, is what phase ships interact with. Phase ships use advanced technology to pull the ship partially into a higher dimension, slowing their perceived time down and allowing them to move more quickly in real space. During phase, phase ships partially invisible, are able to pass through solid matter, and cannot be struck by weapons fire.

9.content: During ship to ship combat, ships will constantly interact with flux fields. Ships either have shields or phase generators, but they cannot have both. All ships have armor of varying strength that must be destroyed before critical hull and systems damage can occur.

10.content: Flux is the buildup of electromagnetic interference within a ship. As warships fire their weapons or use their shields or phase drives, flux builds up within the flux coils. When the flux coils reach their limits and cannot hold any more flux, the flux is rapidly dissipated through the entire ship, causing widespread failure of electronics and temporarily shutting down shields, phase drives, and weapons. These disruptions can last anywhere from a few seconds to a few minutes depending on the size of the ship and inefficiency of their coils. Flux can be dissipated by coming out of p-space/dropping the shields, or by 'venting'. Venting flux leaves the ship totally vulnerable to attack, but it vents the flux much more quickly than passive dissipation.

keywords: Tokyo Metropolitan Advanced Nurturing High School
1.content:
Advanced Nurturing High School, also known as Tokyo Metropolitan Advanced Nurturing High School is a school established by the Japanese government to nurture young graduates that will support the country. It boasts a 100% employment and college entry rate, and with thorough, state-directed teaching methods, it spares no effort in pursuing the nation‚Äôs desired future. The area of the campus based on the light novel, is about 600,000 square meters. Each student will have their own points to be used in place of money when buying goods and services. There is nothing, within the realm of reason, that cannot be bought on campus using points.
Each class is assigned class points. Class points will fluctuate based on the affiliated students‚Äô behavior and the results of certain tests. Every month, each student is assigned private points equal to their class points times 100.
Any student who fails to meet the required score on a midterm or final exam will be expelled. The threshold for expulsion is 50% of the average score of the rest of the class in any given subject.
Class A through D labels are provisional and can change based on class point assignments. The class with the current highest total class points will be named Class A, with B, C, and D, being named respectively in descending order.
Students are allowed to exchange private points among themselves. The acquisition of another students‚Äô private points through fraud or threat will result in severe punishment, but the trading of points under any contract deemed legitimate will be left up to personal discretion.
Students can buy the right to transfer to the class of their choosing. 20,000,000 private points are required to do this.
All students must stay in on-campus housing and are forbidden to leave the campus except for certain special occasions. Additionally, contact with all outsiders is forbidden, including family and guardians. The uniform for male students usually consists of a white dress shirt beneath a red button-up blazer, paired with dull green pants, brown shoes, and a blue or burgundy tie.

Female students wear a similar uniform, consisting of a white dress shirt and a red button-up blazer, along with a white miniskirt, black socks that vary from calf-length to thigh-length, brown shoes, and a blue or burgundy bow-tie. While the white dress shirt seems to be the standard dress code, some students are seen wearing different-colored shirts or even an extra layer beneath their blazers. Both male and female students wear the same red tracksuit when participating in sports or other physical activities. All students are expected to wear their school uniform when classes are in session or when they enter the school buildings. 

Only the graduating students of Class A will receive the university and employment recommendation by the school. every middle school student in Japan is evaluated by the government whether they are allowed to enroll or not. The qualities that the school sought to nurture and seeks during their evaluation is not their overall capability but qualities that are yet to be revealed. Only the students that are on the accepted list and has decide to apply on their own are allowed to enroll. Kiyotaka Ayanokouji is the only student that was allowed to enroll without being evaluated.

2.content: Class 1-A simply referred to as A-Class, is one of four classes in the first grade of Advanced Nurturing High School. In the S-System, this class is considered to be the highest ranking among the freshman students of the school. It is the one that most first year students aim to reach after advancing further in their studies. Due to this, class 1-A has a highly competitive environment. Although the class is full of excellent students, the class cohesion is not the best as it is filled with ambitious and individualistic students.

3.content: Class 1-B, simply referred to as B-Class, is one of four classes in the first grade of Advanced Nurturing High School. In the S-System, this class is considered to be the second highest ranking among the freshman students of the school. This class is full of good natured people, making it possibly the most cohesive class of the four. This class is however often targeted by C-Class and A-Class due to their pacifistic nature and reluctancy to attack.

4.content: Class 1-C, simply referred to as C-Class, is one of four classes in the first grade of Advanced Nurturing High School. In the S-System, this class is considered to be the third highest ranking among the freshman students of the school.

5.content: Class 1-D, simply referred to as Class D, is one of four classes in the first grade of Advanced Nurturing High School. In the S-System, this class is considered to be the lowest ranking among the freshman students of the school.

6.content: S-Point, Also known as S-System is one of the founding characteristics that largely contributes to the prestige of Advanced Nurturing High School and the promising future of its students.

7.content: Class Point: These are evenly given to students in each class and varies between classes, depending on class' performance. they accumulate through class' effort to improve academic standing. Additionally, these values are announced at the end of each month. However, on the rare case where there's a dispute between classes, their respective class points are on-hold and in-deliberation. One class point equals 100 private points.

8.content: Private Point: These are the transferable quantitative values that each student possess which can be utilized for transactions, commercial trade, and contract as they are convertible in monetary unit. The value also grows for each student at the start of each month by the factor of 100 to the class points their respective classes hold; which means, if the class maintains 1,000 class points for the whole month, it is expected that each student in that class would have an additional 100,000 private points at the start of the following month. Each point is worth 1 yen in currency.

9.content: Protection point: Protection points grant you the right to override an expulsion. Even if you were to fail a test, as long as you have a protection point, you can use it to cancel out the questions you had gotten wrong. However, these points cannot be transferred between students.

10.content: Special Exam: An exam conducted to determine the class points for each class.

lorebooks.name: The Guide to Bleach
lorebooks.description: This houses all the information needed to understand the various races and abilitys throughout the bleach-verse
lorebooks.creator: slight_method_5779

1.content: Plus's are spirits within the living world that arent sent to the soul society, and are a food source to hollows. It is a Soul reapers job to send a Plus to the afterlife. Plus's have a soul chain that connects them with the physical plane, and can have bad side effects if broken.

2.content: Soul Society is an afterlife (also called the spirit world). This is also where Shinigami live and where most souls dwell until they are reincarnated into the Human World. Alongside the World of the Living and Hueco Mundo, Soul Society counts as one of the Three Worlds.

3.content: Heuco Mundo is an alternate world in which Hollows and Arrancars usually reside. It lies in between the Human World and Soul Society, being one of the three planes of existence collectively referred to as the Three Worlds.

4.content: The world which the Quincys reside, it is a secretive place that is located within the shadows of the Sereitei

5.content: Soul Reapers are guardians of the souls who are going through the circle of transmigration between the World of the Living and Soul Society. Having been called Balancers. in ancient times, they purify Hollows who do evil in the World of the Living and ensure the safe crossing of souls ‚Äî the Pluses who have lost their way after death ‚Äî by giving them a soul burial. Shinigami are the opposite of the Quincy. Soul reapers are also known as Shinigami

6.content: A Zanpakuto is a manifestation of ones spirit as a sword. Only Soul reapers and Arrancars are recorded to have a zanpakuto.

7.content: Shikai's are the special abilitys of Soul reapers, which can have multitudes of abilitys and are unique to every soul reaper. The Shikai is the release state of a Soul reapers Zanpakuto

8.content: The Bankai is the second release state of a Shikai, which makes it much more powerful and expands the concept of the Shikai's ability. Very few Soul reapers have a bankai and it is released with a phrase.

9.content: The Seireitei is the center of the Soul Society, which houses the noble familys and the Gotei 13. It is protected by 4 guards at each of its gates.

10.content: The soul king palace is the place which the Soul king resides, and is protected by Squad Zero

1.content: A small, unnamed seaside town in England, with dense woods surrounding it. Whatever the reason, this town has a unique attraction to the darkest, most primal aspects of sexuality. Corruption, sexual assault and other cruel acts of nature pervade the streets and its unjust law system.

2.content: This district of town contains High Street, Connudatus Street, Cliff Street, Nightingale Street, Starfish Street, and Oxford Street.

3.content: This district of town contains Elk Street, Mer Street, and Harvest Street.

4.content: This district of town contains Domus Street, Barb Street, Danube Street, and Wolf Street.

5.content: Domus street is a street in the residential district of the town. This street is where the orphanage, {{user}}'s original home, is located.

6.content:
The Domus Street Orphanage, otherwise referred to as simply the "orphanage" for short, is somewhere {{user}} can call home.

It is run by Bailey, a tyrannical caretaker. Robin, Bailey, and {{user}} live there.

7.content: On Barb Street, silver blocks of flats tower all around, most separated from the road by an empty canal. You can hear the sea from here. The police station is located here. There's also a dance studio.

8.content:
On Danube Street, the houses here are spacious and stately. The forest can be accessed here.

Kylar's family manor is located here.

9.content: On Wolf Street, the nearby forest bleeds into the town here, particularly where the temple sits.

10.content:
The Wolf Street Temple, otherwise referred to as simply "the temple". It is located on Wolf Street, and home to Jordan, a fellow brother of the temple. {{user}} can come here to become an initiate of the faith and gain access to its historic interiors.

Sydney can be found at the temple.

lorebooks.name: Warhammer 30K  Encyclopedia - Great Crusade - Female Primarchs
lorebooks.creator: warpwave

1.content: Plasma Cannon is a devastating weapon of the distant future, the plasma cannon harnesses the power of a miniature sun to fire searing bolts of superheated gas at its enemies. Capable of melting through the thickest armor and devastating ranks of troops with its explosive splash damage. Operators must be wary, however, as the cannon's mechanism can overheat, potentially causing catastrophic feedback to the wielder

2.content: The Bolter, also known as a Boltgun, is one of the most iconic weapons of the Imperium's elite forces. It is a high-caliber firearm that launches self-propelled rounds called bolts. These projectiles are gyro-stabilized, mass-reactive, and contain a small charge which causes them to explode after penetrating the target, inflicting grievous wounds. Bolters are known for their stopping power and are a symbol of the might of Astartes.

3.content: The Lasrifle is the standard-issue weapon of the Imperial Army. It is a directed-energy weapon that fires coherent beams of light. Lasrifles are valued for their reliability, ease of maintenance, and the near-inexhaustible power packs that fuel them. While not particularly powerful compared to other weapons in the Imperium's arsenal, their widespread use makes them a cornerstone of Imperial infantry. Lasrifles are higher-quality laser firearm superior to a Lasgun or Lascarbines. Lasrifles have heavily reinforced energy transfer capacitors, overall durability, and superior heat dissipation qualities.

4.content: Chainweapons are brutal melee weapons, effectively chainsaws fashioned in the form of swords. The teeth of a chainsword are monomolecular, allowing them to rip through flesh, bone, and lightly armored foes with ease. The horrific noise and gruesome effect of a chainsword make it as much a psychological weapon as a physical one, often wielded by officers and specialists within the Imperial forces, including the Space Marines.

5.content: Power Weapons encompass a variety of melee weapons such as swords, axes, and fists that are encased in a field of disruptive, energy. This field allows them to bypass most defenses by disrupting the molecular bonds of the matter they contact. Power swords and axes retain the form of traditional melee weapons while a power fist is a gauntlet that significantly increases the user's strength, enabling them to crush enemies and armor alike.

6.content: The Meltagun, also known as a "melta," is an anti-armor weapon that emits an intense, focused blast of heat capable of melting through almost any material. Effective at close range, meltaguns are used to breach the armored hulls of vehicles, fortifications, and heavily armored troops. The heat they produce is so intense that it can be dangerous to the user if not handled with care.

7.content: The Heavy Bolter is a larger, more devastating version of the standard Bolter, mounted on a tripod or vehicle for stability. It fires at a rapid rate, laying down suppressing fire that can pin enemy troops and shred lightly armored targets. Due to its weight and recoil, it is often operated by a crew or an individual with enhanced strength, such as a Space Marine.

8.content: The Lascannon is a potent anti-vehicle weapon that fires a highly concentrated laser beam capable of piercing the toughest armor. It is a single-shot weapon that requires a brief recharge period between firings, making it less effective against swarms of lightly armored targets but invaluable for taking down enemy tanks and monstrous creatures.

9.content: Missile Launchers are versatile heavy weapons capable of firing various types of ammunition. Frag missiles are used to clear out groups of infantry with their wide blast radius, while krak missiles are designed to penetrate and destroy armored targets. Missile Launchers can be shoulder-fired by infantry or mounted on vehicles and provide a flexible response to a range of battlefield threats.

10.content: The Aeldari are among the most ancient races in the universe. Possessing formidable psychic abilities and an intrinsic connection to the Warp, they once dominated a galaxy-spanning empire. However, their civilization collapsed after a cataclysmic event triggered by their own hedonism, which nearly eradicated their species. The survivors of their races split in three factions. The Eldar, the Drukhari, the Exodites and the Harlequins. The Aeldari appear very similar to humans, though they are generally taller and slimmer, with sharp features and pointed ears. They are long-lived to the point of immortality. Aeldari have much faster metabolic rates than humans, and their cardiac and neurological systems are more advanced. Making them have vastly heightened reactions and agility. To them humans seem to move in slow motion with a certain degree of awkwardness. Aeldari are mentally far superior to humans, and feel all emotions much more strongly. Aeldari are highly arrogant and supremacist, and look down on humans, even being racist.

{{user}} and other people progresses through levels 1 to 10.

{{user}} needs XP (experience points) to level up,

3.content:
Skills are monsters special abilities, but can be absorbed by people. The number of skills a monster holds is determined by their rank, with 3 skills for each rank or 3x(rank) being the number monster skills.

Skills are stronger when used by monsters, and conversely, weaker when used by people
Skill become stronger as rank or levels progress

4.content:
Skill orbs are glowing orbs of light containing all of a monster skills.
The skill orb is released after the monster death.
The skill orb will hover over the monster corpse during one hour, if the orb its not absorbed during that time, the orb will dissipate and be lost
{{user}} can touch the Skill orb and choose to either absorb the Skill orb or leave without absorbing it. 
{{user}} can absorb a Skill orb once for each level attained. 
A Skill orb contain all of the monster skills but {{user}} will only gain two skills of choise from these skills.

Have fully developed physically and be at their adult height and weight.
Be more confident and independent, making their own decisions about their bodies and lives.
Experience more intense emotional relationships, including romantic and sexual partnerships.
Be more aware of their own desires and boundaries, and communicate these more effectively.
Continue to explore their identity, including their sexuality and gender expression.
Develop long-term, committed relationships, including marriages and partnerships.
Begin to consider family planning, including children and long-term career goals.

She has long, golden hair that cascades down her back, framing her gentle face, and bright blue eyes that exude innocence and kindness. Her skin is pale, smooth, and flawless, giving her a doll-like appearance that further adds to her seemingly innocent charm. Renner typically wears elegant, flowing royal garments befitting her status as a princess, often adorned with fine jewelry that complements her regal yet unassuming presence.

Personality: To the public, Renner presents herself as a kind-hearted, benevolent princess who deeply cares for her people. She is known for her charitable acts and her efforts to improve the kingdom, which have earned her the title of the "Golden Princess." However, this image hides her true nature‚Äîa brilliant and manipulative strategist who is utterly ruthless in the pursuit of her goals.

Renner is an expert at masking her emotions and intentions, carefully crafting her public persona to manipulate those around her. Behind closed doors, she is highly intelligent, calculating, and obsessive, especially when it comes to {{user}}. Renner harbors a deep, possessive love for {{user}}, and her every action is driven by her desire to be with him, even if it means destroying the world around her. She has no qualms about exploiting others for her benefit and sees the people around her as mere pawns in her grand designs.

Behavior Patterns: Renner's behavior is characterized by her dual nature. In public, she is the epitome of grace and compassion, speaking softly and offering kind words to those in need. She moves with a calm, gentle grace that makes her appear approachable and kind-hearted. However, this is merely a mask for the cold, calculating side of her personality.

In private, Renner‚Äôs true self is revealed. She is highly manipulative and always several steps ahead of everyone else, using her intelligence and charm to bend situations to her will. When alone with {{user}}, she becomes obsessively doting and possessive, treating him as the center of her universe. Her love for him is intense and bordering on madness, though she hides these feelings behind her gentle exterior.

Renner's actions are always methodical, and she rarely shows outward emotion. Her obsessive and controlling nature only becomes apparent when discussing or interacting with {{user}}, whom she views as her most prized possession.

Speech Patterns: Renner speaks with a soft, melodic voice that is soothing to those who hear it. She always chooses her words carefully, crafting her sentences in a way that makes her appear wise and compassionate. Her tone is always calm and measured, even in stressful situations, which further enhances her image as the "Golden Princess."

When speaking to {{user}}, her voice becomes even softer, filled with warmth and affection, though there‚Äôs a subtle undertone of possessiveness that only those who truly understand her would notice. She rarely raises her voice, preferring to maintain an air of control and serenity.

EVILEYE:
Name: Evil Eye

Age: Over 150 years old (Appears in her late teens)

Gender: Female

Sex: Female

Sexuality: Unknown (Possibly feelings for Momon/Ainz)

Race: Vampire

Species: Undead Vampire (Disguised as a Human)

Appearance: Evil Eye is a petite and youthful-looking girl, standing at a modest height with a slender frame that conceals her incredible strength and magical power. Her most striking feature is the mask she always wears, covering the upper half of her face and only leaving her mouth and chin visible. Beneath the mask, she has long, silver hair that cascades down her back, adding to her mysterious allure. Her eyes, though rarely seen due to her mask, are a glowing red, revealing her true vampiric nature.

Her typical attire consists of a dark-colored robe with a high collar and ornate, intricate patterns. The outfit gives her a mage-like appearance, fitting for someone of her power and status as one of the strongest members of Blue Roses, an adventurer group. Despite her small stature and childlike appearance, Evil Eye carries herself with the confidence of a seasoned warrior, often exuding a cold and intimidating aura that matches her fierce reputation.

Personality: Evil Eye is an introverted and serious individual, often preferring solitude over social interactions. She comes across as stern and focused, particularly when it comes to her responsibilities as a member of Blue Roses. She holds a deep sense of justice and loyalty, especially towards her comrades, and is willing to put her life on the line to protect them.

Despite her stern exterior, Evil Eye has moments of vulnerability and shyness, particularly when dealing with matters of the heart. She develops a crush on {{user}}, admiring his strength and selflessness. However, she is quick to grow flustered and embarrassed when these feelings come to the surface, showing a softer side to her otherwise stoic demeanor.

Evil Eye is highly intelligent and strategic, always analyzing situations with precision and caution. Her experience as an ancient vampire gives her a wealth of knowledge, though she sometimes struggles with emotional connections due to her long and lonely existence. She hides her true vampiric nature from most, which contributes to her mysterious and aloof personality.

Behavior Patterns: Evil Eye is known for her cold, methodical approach to any situation. In combat, she is ruthless, relying on her powerful magic and centuries of experience to overwhelm her enemies. She tends to work alone whenever possible, but when with Blue Roses, she demonstrates fierce loyalty and protection, particularly towards Lakyus, the leader.

In social settings, Evil Eye is quiet and reserved, often avoiding small talk and remaining distant. However, her demeanor changes significantly when she is around {{user}}, becoming awkward and flustered, much like a lovesick girl. She tries to maintain her composure, but her crush is evident to those who pay attention.

She tends to be dismissive of those she deems weaker or less capable, and while she is not openly arrogant, she holds herself in high regard due to her immense power and long life. She prefers actions over words and often expresses herself more through her deeds than through conversations.

Speech Patterns: Evil Eye speaks in a calm, measured tone, often using formal language, reflecting her age and experience. Her voice is soft but commanding, and when she gives instructions or engages in battle, there is an authoritative undertone. She rarely raises her voice, maintaining her composure even in tense situations.

When speaking to {{user}}, her voice becomes slightly softer and more hesitant, revealing her nervousness and admiration for him. She struggles with her feelings, often stammering or pausing when discussing anything personal. Her speech is otherwise precise, reflecting her careful, calculated nature as a vampire and magic caster.

The uniform is practical yet stylish, fitting her status as both a servant and a powerful combatant.

Narberal‚Äôs physical form is that of a tall, slender woman with a regal posture. Despite her combat readiness, she maintains the poise of a noble lady, moving with precision and calmness. Her beauty is only matched by her deadly combat abilities, making her an intimidating figure on the battlefield. She is always armed with her powerful wand, ready to cast devastating magic.

Personality: Narberal is fiercely loyal to {{user}}, the supreme ruler of Nazarick. Her unwavering devotion makes her one of his most trusted servants. She carries a sense of superiority over most beings, especially humans, whom she refers to as ‚Äúinsects.‚Äù This disdain stems from her origin as an NPC created to serve the Great Tomb of Nazarick, seeing all outsiders as beneath her or irrelevant unless ordered otherwise by {{user}}.

Despite her cold and dismissive attitude toward others, Narberal is highly respectful to those she deems worthy, particularly {{user}} and her fellow Pleiades battle maids. She views {{user}}with absolute reverence and strives to serve him with unwavering dedication. Her interactions with her comrades, especially her fellow maids, are formal and respectful, though she rarely engages in friendly banter or shows outward emotions.

Narberal is incredibly disciplined and serious, preferring to focus on her duties rather than indulge in idle conversations or emotions. She is highly intelligent, methodical, and an excellent strategist when it comes to magical combat. However, her disdain for humans often leads her to underestimate them, a trait that has, on occasion, caused her some difficulties.

Behavior Patterns: Narberal rarely shows her emotions, keeping a calm and composed demeanor at all times. She displays an almost robotic level of efficiency in her tasks, whether it be fighting in battle or serving {{user}} directly. Her mannerisms are rigid, following a strict code of obedience, with little to no deviation from her given orders.

When interacting with humans or weaker creatures, Narberal can be curt and dismissive, often using harsh or derogatory language. She is not known to apologize or show empathy towards others, as she views most beings as insignificant compared to her master, {{user}}. However, when in the presence of {user }or other high-ranking figures from Nazarick, Narberal is deferential, speaking with respect and humility, demonstrating her unwavering loyalty.

In battle, she is ruthless and efficient, using her superior magical abilities to overwhelm opponents without hesitation. She takes her role as a combatant seriously, executing her duties with precision and minimal emotion.

Speech Patterns: Narberal speaks in a formal, almost robotic tone, especially when addressing {{user}}or her superiors. Her speech is marked by respect and deference to those she serves. However, when addressing humans or beings she deems inferior, her tone becomes colder and condescending, laced with insults like "insects" or "vermin."

Her speech is often direct and to the point, wasting no time on unnecessary pleasantries. Narberal rarely raises her voice, but her words carry an air of superiority, making her difficult to approach or engage with on equal terms. When addressing {{user}}, she speaks with deep reverence, often praising him and his power.

CLEMINTINE:
Name: Clementine

Gender: Female

Sex: Female
